1.content:
Here are your choices....

1. My name is Jon Que, age fourteen. I have sand blond hair and hazel eyes. I'm very athletic but I tend to shy away from most people as I have this fear of hurting them. The guys think I'm just paranoid but I'm not so sure...

2. My name is Jessica Wild, age thirteen. I have long black hair and green eyes. I come from a long line of wiccans, whatever those are. I seem to have a natural talent in dealing with boys but I really don't like them much...

3. My name is Tom Graves, age fifteen. I have longish brown hair and brown eyes. I love animals and feel as if I can connect to them but other people, they just annoy me. Maybe its just a phase I'm going through, who knows.

4. My name is Sarah Summers, age sixteen. I have blond hair and blue eyes. That's all you're getting , deal with it.

Who will you chose?
1.title: Who am I??

choices: On a steel table in a high tech lab.
11.content:
It all started on my first day of high school. I got out of bed after mom yelled for me to get up about nine times then staggered into the bathroom and took my shower. It was the same old routine, just going to a new school. I was always usually the first to get up but, for some reason, I had a difficult time waking up that morning. The hot water of the shower helped but I could not shake how tired I felt.

"Jon, you better get going or you're going to be late!" yelled my mom from the living room. "Katie has already left and I have to get Sam to the bus stop!"

"I'm coming, mom!" I called, hurrying. "Just a second!"

My older sister, Katie, was nineteen and just starting college, she had already left for the week. My younger brother, Sam, got bused to school as it was five miles away. As for me, I didn't get any busing as my new school was only about two miles away from our house, it sucked to have to walk but what could I do, I was running late.

"I'm coming!" I called again, running down the stairs. "I'll grab a bite to eat at the cafeteria before home room."

"You better, young man." scolded mom. "If you look this pale when you get home, you are going to the hospital."

My mom worked as a doctor at the local hospital so she had little time to get me and my siblings going. She nearly kept me home as I was looking pale the night before but it was my first day, I wanted to go. I gave mom a quick kiss and ran out the door as she yelled out, "Don't take the short cut through the woods, you hear me!?"

"Yeah, yeah!" I replied, running off."

It wasn't long before I realized just how late I actually was and decided to take the shortcut through the dense woods. Mom had told me, when I was a lot younger, that there were reports of strange going ons in the dense woods between my house and the new high school and there were many protests about building the school on the far edge of it. I never really believed the wild tales of screams in the night and mysterious moaning during the day. Still, I kept my guard up anyway, just in case, as the woods were as dark as night inside. I thought I was ready for anything, having heard all of the stories a thousand times, but I was not ready for the ground beneath me to suddenly give way...

"Woah!" I screamed, falling in. As I fell further and further, I knew I was in trouble. "Oh, Shi..."

I hit the ground and blacked out...

When I woke up in what seemed like hours later, I found myself...
11.title: How it started...

choices: "...We're going to have to keep you in longer."
"...There's something different about you. We have to run more tests."
111.content:
My eyes opened slowly, the dim light of the room seeping into my pupils. They shrank, hiding from the sudden light before adjusting. As I glanced around me I saw I was in a room by myself, the blinds pulled down to hide most of the sun. I lay in one of those high rise beds with rails on either side so I couldn't fall out. I had a bedside table to my left and to my right there was one of those trolleys that hovered over your bed.

As if on cue, a nurse opened my door and walked in, a smile on her face. "Hi Jon," she grinned. "You're looking a little better."

"What happened?" I asked, my voice was croaky.

"We're still trying to figure that out ourselves," she told me. She picked up my chart from the bottom of the bed and began to flip through it. "You seemed to have a fall."

"But I fell okay now, can I go home?" I wasn't lying. I did feel much better and didn't see the point being cooped up in bed. Besides, I was missing my first day at school.

"Sorry hon, not yet," she shook her head. "We're doing a few tests."

"Tests, what for?" I asked, confused.


"Well, you're looking awfully pale. We're worried you might be suffering from anaemia."

"Oh.”

“Don’t worry, it won’t take much longer and your mum is on her way.”

“Okay.”

“I’m just going to take some blood before she gets here, that okay?”

“Sure,” I held out my arm for her, exposing my vein. She took the blood and left me alone once more. The silence in the room was deafening.

A few minutes later my mum walked through the door, her eyes misting up as soon as she saw me. She rushed to my bed, smothering me with cuddles.

“Oh my boy,” she stroked my hair, pushing it back from my head.

“Mum stop fussing,” I snapped pushing her hand away.

“What happened?” she asked.

“I fell,” I told her. “They’re just doing some blood tests to make sure I’m okay before I can go.”

As if on cue the nurse walked back into the room.

“I’m afraid I have some bad news….” She began.
111.title: In a hospital room.

1111.content:
"What do you mean he has no blood type?" asked mum, turning pale. "His blood type is O negative."

"I'm sorry, Mrs. Que, the tests did not show an O negative blood type but something quite different." replied the nurse, turning pale herself. "In fact, we are unable to determine what it is that's coursing through his veins."

I began to panic as I turned to mum. "Please tell me this is a joke." I begged her. "Tell me this is to get back at me for taking a short cut through those woods."

Mum teared up, shaking her head. "I never joke when it comes to your health, Jon." she whispered. "Though I must ask, if you did not draw blood from my son's arms... what did you get?"

Just then, the doctor entered. He was tall, moderate build, with black hair and green eyes. He took the chart from the nurse and quietly excused her from the room before turning to me and mum. "I am doctor Khan, the leading expert in transmutations in this area." he said. "I'm afraid I have some grave news to tell you both."

Mum and I exchanged a startled look before turning to Khan. "Please, what's wrong with my son!?" demanded mum.

"The woods that your son had entered was deemed forbidden for good reason." replied Khan. "It is the sight of an illegal dumping ground for a research company whose workers had all vanished ten years ago." he swallowed hard, throwing me a look of pity. "I'm terribly sorry, Jon but you are mutating."

"Mu-Mutating!?" I asked, stunned.

"Into what, exactly!?" demanded mum, hugging me again.

"We don't know as normally, any person who wanders into those woods is found dead... or worse." replied Khan, sadly. "You are the first victim of that area to survive."

I felt my jaw drop as if to scream only mum screamed for me as...
1111.title: "...You have no blood type."

11111.content:
I felt my jaw drop as if to scream only mum screamed for me as the world around me was growing.... or was i shrinking?

"Jon.. oh my... Doctor what is happening to my son?" asked mom.

The nurse rushed instantly to me while I stared in the mirror in the room. Not only that I regressed in age but my face changed too...gone were my blond hair and my hazel eyes... instead of them i saw white, no almost silver like hair and blood red eyes.

What shocked me most was that my reflection looked more like a ten year old girl than a boy. I was so focused on the mirror that I didn't noticed that the nurse was rushing towards me until she was between me and the mirror...

The last thing I remembered was becoming very thirsty before my world went black.
11111.title: I regressed in age!

11112.content:
I felt my jaw drop as if to scream only mum screamed for me as she and I saw what could only had been described as 'cement' seeping out of my pours! It was light grey, the color of stone, and cracked as it seemingly hardened onto my skin instantly. The 'cement' began to secrete out of my feet then move up my legs, making them feel heavy as the 'stone epoxy' reached my thighs.

"What's happening to my son!?" distraught, mum screamed. "Do something!"

Dr Khan shook his head, stunned as he could do nothing but watch helplessly as my body seemed to rapidly change to that of stone! I could not move ay part of my body that had changed, it felt super heavy but I was surprised that I could still feel everything my body touched. "Am I becoming a living being of stone?" startled, I thought. "Is that even possible!?"

I opened my mouth again as if to scream but my face froze that way as it too turned to stone and froze that way in a state of permanent fear. Mum was silent for a moment then hugged my unmoving form, crying hysterically. I could feel her tears falling onto my body and running down my own cheeks. I was still alive! "Maybe... if I really tried, I can move." I thought, desperate. "I have to try!"

With that, I made my best effort and...
11112.title: My body turned to stone!

choices: I remain a boy of stone.
111122.content:
Feeling air moving in and out of my own lungs, I made my best effort to speak and, to my surprise, I found that I could but only very slowly as it was hard to move a single muscle. "Hard to move." my voice very deep I said. "Feel heavy."

Mum stared at me for a moment then fell into another round of tears. "He's alive!" sobbing, she yelled. "Doctor, help him!"

Dr. Khan, hearing me as well, immediately called in a number of nurses who gasped at the sight of my body. "Our patient is suffering from a massive calcium build up." explaining, he said. "Don't ask for details, we need to help him move his body before everything solidifies and he will never be able to move again!"

Getting to work, Dr Khan, the nurses, and even mum worked on getting me to move every part of my body. It was painful as my body now felt so heavy it was torturous to my muscles. I heard myself scream a number of times, begging everyone to stop but Dr Khan insisted I keep moving. I was in so much pain, it felt as if they were at me for days when it had barely been an hour before I was finally able to somewhat move on my own. It was still difficult though and I was desperate to lay back down but Dr Khan shook his head.

"I know you are tired, Jon." patiently, he said. "I have seen this condition in the woods before." he winced. "Trust me, you do not want to stop moving until you can get to the point you are able to move freely."

I was about to protest as I was becoming irritable but stopped as I heard a loud crack, followed my another. Each one was followed by one part of my body being able to move more freely. Within minutes, I was able to freely move and looked down to find what looked like a random pile of rocks all around me. I turned to Dr Khan, confused.

"That was your first layer of 'skin' falling off, Jon." he said. "You may not know this but your transformation added at least a foot to your height and a good hundred pounds." pausing, he added, "What you have is a condition known only in mythology, the birth of a stone golem."

"A- A what!?" surprised that I was also able to speak better, I asked.

"If our efforts pay off, you will be losing the other 'shell' in a moment." serious, Dr Khan said. "Weather it will come back only time will tell."

"And if your efforts didn't pay off?" nervous, I asked.

Dr Khan sighed and showed me a mirror. "If they didn't pay off, this is your new look."

Looking into the mirror, I screamed as I saw my own face but it appeared to have been carved from solid rock!
111122.title: Managed to speak.

choices: after the tests, free to go.
1111221.content:
Just as I was about to fall into hysterical tears over my cruel new fate, I heard a loud crack, then another, and another until I saw the stone skin falling from me like an avalanche. When it was over, I found that I was myself again but blushed brightly, discovering I was completely naked. The nurses blushed and started to giggle as they turned away but mum was quick to grab a sheet and wrap it around me. "Easy, Jon, it's okay." gently picking me up from the rock pile, she said. "You're free from the stone, you're going to be alright now."

"Actually, this may only be the beginning." wincing, Dr Khan said. "I want to run a full series of tests, just to be safe."

"You- You think I might turn into stone again?" startled, I asked.

"As I said before, you are the first to survive this petrifying process." serious, Dr Khan said. "We have no idea what to expect so I need to run tests on you and your 'shed skin' to see what is going on inside of you."

I gulped, uncertain what to do and turned to mum who nodded at me. "It's best you let them run the tests." firmly but kindly, she said. "Especially since everyone else this happened to had died."

I could not argue with that and slowly nodded. "Okay."
1111221.title: The stone skin falls off.

11112211.content:
"I will start with another blood sample." prepping a needle, Dr Khan said. "It's just like before, nothing to worry about."

I nodded and watched as Dr Khan moved to push the needle into my skin only he could not push it through. In fact, the needle broke under the pressure he was using to try to pierce through. "What's wrong, doctor?" worried, I asked.

"It seems as if the last secretion of... err... living stone has made your skin much more dense than usual." taking up a scalpel, Dr Khan replied. "I'm going to see if I can't make an incision and take a blood sample that way." looking at me, he said, "Relax, I'll be as gentle as I can."

With that, Dr Khan brought the blade down and tried to make an incision but, to his dismay, the blade would not make a scratch on my skin. "Amazing." shaking his head, Khan said. "Simply amazing. Your skin had become like a suit of armor, I can not get through it by normal means." pausing to think, he turned to mum. "Do I have your permission to try a medical drill to get a blood sample?"

"What!?!" fearful, I asked.

I was not about to allow this man, doctor or not to drill holes in me. Only, to my horror, mum reluctantly nodded. "Just try to be gentle, doctor." sighing, she said. "My son is petrified as it is." she winced, seeing my expression. "Sorry, wrong choice of words."

"I promise I will only drill far enough down to draw a little blood to study." leaving the room, Khan said. "I'll only be a minute, I have to run to surgery to get the medical drill."

"It's going to be alright, Jon." trying to sound comforting, mum said. "We need to learn what is happening inside of you so we can deal with it, okay?"

"I'm scared, mum." trembling, I said.

"So am I, dear." honestly, mum said. "I'm scared for you."

Presently, Khan returned with what looked like a small version of a battery operated hand drill and opened a small package that contained a sterile drill. "Normally, we use this drill to make a hole in a patient's skull to relieve pressure in case if internal bleeding." preparing the drill, he said. "I hope this will break through that skin of yours."

With a frightening whirring sound, the drill came to life and Khan brought it down onto my arm and began to push, the drill immediately straining. Slowly, and with effort, the drill bit finally broke through and my arm began to bleed slightly through the puncture wound. "At last." sweating slightly, Khan said.

Moving quickly, Khan got a blood sample then instructed a nurse to send it to the lab to be analyzed carefully and thoroughly. "i want the results the moment they are in." he instructed.

"Of course, doctor." nodding, the nurse replied. then she was gone.

"Um.. doctor." my eyes widening, I said. "It's happening again!"

Khan spun around and saw the 'cement' seeping out of the puncture wound. "Hold still!" grabbing a scalpel, he said. "I'll need to get a sample of the fresh matter to study!"

Scraping a piece of the 'cement' while it was still liquid, Khan quickly placed it into a glass jar and sealed it closed before turning to mum. "We have to get your son moving around so this... next layer will fall off."

Mum nodded tearfully, remembering how much I screamed the first time. The process of making me move in my now even heavier form began and I screamed out in agony, not having the time to recover from the first bout with the new weight and mass. However, moving freely became a little faster than before but the rock form did not fall off as it did the first time. "I thought this was supposed to fall off of me!" confused and frightened, I said.

"I don't know what to expect, Jon." honestly, Khan said. "This is new territory for both of us so we are just going to have to wing it and move on with the tests." the then held out a compression stick. "Say ah...."

I opened my mouth and said, "Ah!" and was surprised by how deep my voice was and how it seemed to shake the windows of the room. "Jon!" scolding, mum said. "There is no need to shout!"

"I don't think he was shouting." as I pouted, Khan said. "I believe his voice is simply more powerful in this form."

The test continued for nearly twenty minutes before a familiar cracking sound was heard and my rock skin fell off, revealing my normal skin again only it was now a light shade of grey. "The secretions seem to be changing his body." frowning, Khan said. "This is not good."

"What do you mean?" frightened, I asked.

Khan sighed. "I do not know if I can reverse this." looking at you, he said. "You may permanently become a person of living stone unless I can find a way to change that."

I broke down at that as mum comforted me.

"Try to get some rest, Jon." tiredly, Khan said. "We will pick this up again in a half hour."

"Wait!" panicked, I said. "What if the 'cement' comes out again!?"

"I won't be far." promised Khan. "I will help you get to the bottom of this but I don't want to push you or I into exhaustion, we all need to stay alert." serious, he said, "You are the first in a long time to come out of those woods alive, I want it to stay that way."

With that, he left.
11112211.title: More tests.

choices: I think the changes are done for now.
111122111.content:
I woke up the following morning, feeling refreshed. I did not remember being woken up in a half hour, or for several hours, meaning I was either really out of it after the last transformation or Dr Khan decided to let me to sleep through the night. Upon looking at myself, however, I screamed, finding my body encased in that strange stone like shell again. My scream woke up mom and she screamed as well, alerting the medical staff who ran in and began to help me move about as Dr Khan entered with a strange machine on a cart.

"This is the fourth transformation in an hour!" said one nurse, helping me to move my arms.

"He's getting heavier each time." commented another.

"I- I think I can move on my own, ma'am." politely, you said.

The nurses looked at me surprised but stepped away as I freely moved my arms and legs. I got up from the bed, startling everyone, and stood without feeling heavy. I heard sighs of relief as I did not fall, making me guess that I had fallen before during the night. "Was I asleep when you guys worked on me last night?" curious, I asked.

"You were in a sort of daze." gently, the first nurse said.

"Most likely to dumb the pain from moving with all that extra weight." added the second nurse.

"We had to get more and more creative to gain any blood samples from you." motioning to the machine, Khan said. "This is a surgical laser, one of the first portable units ever built." he smiled. "This is the first time all night you had been able to move about without screaming in pain."

"Can I see myself?" politely, I asked.

The first nurse nodded and motioned to a full length mirror on one of the small closet doors. Turning to it, I saw that I was at least a foot taller and that my skin was smooth but light grey in color with what looked like muscle upon muscle on every part of my body. "I look like an alien body builder." managing a smile, I said. "At least I can recognize my face as my own."

The nurses giggled as mom and Khan smiled. "You look rather handsome, Jon." complimenting me, mom said. "A little body paint and you'll look like any regular person."

"Yeah, a regular Olympian." chuckling, I said. "For the first time since I woke up in here, I feel great."

I stared at my reflection in the mirror for a short while, taking in my new look, then turned to Khan. "Do you think I'm done changing or will this all fall off again?" frowning, I asked.

Dr Khan sighed and replied...
111122111.title: The next day...

1111221111.content:
"As I said before, you are the first to survive this." gently, he said. "There is so much we do not know. I have tried to free a number of victims from their stone shell without success." with a mournful look, he added, "They all ended up crumbling into nothing more than a lifeless pile of rocks as we found them already too far gone."

"So I was found early." wincing, I said.

"Actually, you were found on the edge of the woods." surprising me, Khan replied. "So you either managed to get out before the first transformation or someone carried you out."

I turned to mom who nodded. "He's right."

"I don't remember anything beyond falling into a large hole on the path." worried, I said. "Someone must have carried me out of those woods."

"It's best we just be thankful for that." fearful, mom said. "I don't want you going in there any more."

"Back to the subject at hand, your external changes appear to have stopped for the time being." politely, Khan said. "However, I can only guess at the internal changes. X-rays have shown your skeletal structure is more dense than before but it can not show what is happening to your internal organs."

"Is there any way to find out?" worried, mom asked.

"Your son is too heavy to lay on any machine designed to scan his body." sighing, Khan said. "I will have to make a few calls and see if there is any other doctor out there who may have a better idea as to how to approach this."

Well, I feel great." a touch of anxiety in my voice, I said. "When can I head home?"

Dr Khan replied...
1111221111.title: I think the changes are done for now.

11112211111.content:
"Sorry, Jon." wincing, Dr Khan said. "I know you want to go home but we still need to run a few more tests." he sighed, seeing me begin to pout. "Please trust me, I only have your best interests in mind."

"Can I at least see my friends?" hoping, I asked. "Neither you or the nurses were effected being around me so I think its safe to assume that this is not contagious."

"You can have visitors when we are not running tests." smiling, Dr Khan replied. "Only I recommend only one visitor at a time as I still can not see what is happening inside of you. Also, I suggest you tell your visitor your situation in advance so they are prepared."

With that, Dr Khan left the room and mom stepped into my view. "So, who would you like to see first?" smiling, she asked.

I smiled back and replied...
11112211111.title: It's too soon to tell.

111122111112.content:
I was not ready to let my girlfriend, Megan Towers to see me like this, I needed to prepare her first in fear that she may dump me the moment she saw me. I optioned to have mom call my best friend, Mark Harris. Mom made the call and told Mark only that I had run into the woods, hearing a woman's screams and came out changed.

"What do you mean changed!?" fearful, Mark demanded over the phone. "What exactly happened to him!?"

"It's complicated." quickly, mom replied. "Please, Jon needs you now, more than ever."

Ten minutes after ending the call, Mark rushed to my room to find mom waiting in the hall. "I'm here, Ms Que." out of breath, he said. "Can you tell me what happened?"

"You need to prepare yourself, Mark." gently, mom said. "Jon will never be the same again."

Fearing the worst, Mark ran into my room to find a seven foot statue in the middle of the room. Not knowing that statue was me, he asked, "Is this a joke?"

"Shadow Guard and Rock Sentry." in my new deep voice, I said. "Only this is not a role playing game, I wish it were."

Mark's mouth dropped in shock. Shadow Guard was his character name in a role playing game he and I had made up and played with a few friends, including Megan. "Dude, what happened to you!?" stunned, Mark asked.

"I took a shortcut through the creepy woods as I was late for school." sitting onto the floor, I began. "Yeah, I know it was stupid but I did it anyway. Half way down the path, the ground gave way under me and I fell into what looked like a cave and blacked out the second I hit the ground." I sighed. "I woke up here where this happened."

"Can they get it off you?" daring to touch my arm, Mark asked.

"At first, I could not move at all but I managed to speak." sadly, I said. "After the doctor and nurses got me to the point where I could move freely, the rock like skin fell off." I suppressed a sob, adding, "It keeps coming back. Dr Khan seems to think I'm becoming a rock golem; he acts more interested in studying it happening rather than stopping it from changing me completely."

"Have you tried calling other doctors?" concerned, Mark asked. "I could make a few phone calls for you, if you want."

"Please do." looking at my friend, I said. "I'm usually steady as a rock." I chuckled. "No pun intended."

Mark chuckled slightly. "I get it, bro." touching my shoulder, he said. "If this was happening to me too, I'd be...."

I smiled. "Petrified?"

"Scared." correcting me, Mark said. "Do you want me to tell Megan about... you?"

"I want her to be prepared for what she will see first." sadly, I replied. "She might dump me once she sees that I've become... a monster."

"The most handsome man on the planet can be a monster, Jon." serious, Mark said. "You just sit tight and I'll make those calls; my dad is in charge of a investigative team connected to those woods, that would be a good start."

With that, he turned to leave but paused and turned to me. "It's going to be okay, bro." smiling, he said. "We'll work this out, as we always did."

Thank, man." tearing up, i replied. "I'm glad to have you as a friend."

Mark nodded then left the room.

That night...
111122111112.title: my best friend.

1111221111121.content:
It was almost midnight when Mark returned with his father, a near replica of himself. I was awake at the time and greeted them as they entered. Mr Harris took one look at me and frowned. "You are very lucky to be able to speak, let alone move, young man." serious, he said. "I have seen this before and its not pretty."

"Dr Khan told me that as well." tearing up, I replied. "He seems to think I'm turning into a rock golem."

"Well, he's right on that point." serious, Mr Harris said. "However, I think this rocky outer shell is more of a reflex defense response, you were just more able to remain calm or were not aware of your situation when you were pulled out of the woods."

"What do you mean?" confused, you asked.

"My team had discovered that the stone people, as we have come to call them, became that way by a parasite that only seems to live in those woods." calmly, Mr Harris explained. "Once inside a person, they generate massive amounts of calcium to form a protective shield around their host so to protect themselves as well." pausing, he added, "We have taken one of the statues from the woods for study and found that they are slowly changing inside the stone."

"How do you think I was able to speak and move?" fearful, you asked.

"I am not certain." softly, Mr Harris said. "Perhaps it was because you managed to get out of the woods in time so not that many parasites were able to invade your body."

"I don't remember leaving the woods, Mr Harris." I said. "They told me that I was found on the edge of the woods, unconscious."

"Someone had to have pulled you out of that cave if you did not leave yourself." looking at me, Mr Harris said. "Had you stayed where you were, you would have died of hunger and thirst while encased in solid rock."

I gulped, hearing that then asked, "Can you help me, Mr Harris?"

"I fear nothing can reverse your condition." wincing, Mr Harris said. "However, I believe I can stabilize it."

"How?"

"As I told you, the individuals inside the 'statues' are slowly changing." touching my arm, Mr Harris said. "You are doing the same only while freely moving about."

"If they are changing, why have none of them emerged in all these years?" worried, you asked.

"The change could take decades for all we know." shrugging, Mr Harris replied. "There are stories of stone golems wondering the woods." he became thoughtful. "Perhaps it was one of these creatures who pulled you out of the woods."

"Why would such a person or creature do that?" curious, you asked.

"Maybe because the stone golem thought he was giving you a better chance than he had." mussing, Mark said. "Its very possible."

You looked to a window at the woods in the distance and began to wonder...
1111221111121.title: Mark and his father visit.

11112211111211.content:
Was Mr. Harris right? Did some unfortunate soul drag you out to the edge of the woods to spare you that they went through? Was that what really happened? And if you were spared from being over-infected with the parasites, what would happen to you?

One thing was certain... someone helped you...

The next day...
11112211111211.title: Questions

choices: Megan and Mark come with me.
111122111112111.content:
I had just woken up and rose from bed when a knock came to the door; it was Mark. "Hey, bro." peering in, he said. "How are you feeling today?"

"I'm feeling better everyday." managing a smile, I said. "It's just hard to get used to my new look." I then turned to the window, sighing. "I can't help wonder who had pulled me out of the woods."

Mark frowned. "All that matters is that you are alive and moving, Jon." softly, he said. "I brought someone who wants to see you."

I turned to the door and sighed, seeing Megan nervously entering. She was short and thin, so tiny now compared to my new form. She had long light brown hair with gentle blue eyes that perfectly matched her doll like features. She wore her favorite red sundress and black dress shoes. She shivered slightly as her eyes fell upon me but she still smiled kindly. "You look... different, Jon." weakly trying to make me laugh, she said. "I'm glad to hear you feel better."

Although I did not feel like laughing, I managed a smile. "I do feel better." honestly, I said. "Now that you're here, I feel great."

Megan blushed at my compliment and walked towards me. I hesitated but remained still as she wrapped her dainty arms around my waist. "I don't care what you look like." choking a sob, she said. "I still love you and I always will."

I cried, hearing this and slowly fell to my knees before gently hugging her back. I could not think of what to say but I found that words were not needed as Megan began to cry with me. We seemed to have been in that embrace for an eternity before Dr Khan entered the room with a nurse pushing a wheel chair. Upon noticing him and the nurse, I turned from one to the other confused.

"Your case has been moved to another hospital, Jon." disappointment in his voice, Khan said. "We are to take you to an awaiting helicopter to life flight you there."


"Which hospital?" suspicious, Mark asked.

Khan sighed. "Your father and Mr Harris have pulled me off the case, Mr Que." annoyed, he said. "It seems that my notes suggested I was too involved in the development of his condition than finding a cure." he then huffed, whispering, "Ridiculous!"

With that said, the nurse politely led me to the wheel chair and rolled me out of the room....
111122111112111.title: Mark brings a visitor.

1111221111121112.content:
The four nurses who accompanied me on the life flight helicopter were a strange lot to be certain. Their faces seemed to be covered in heavy amounts of makeup and their entire bodies were covered with clothing or bandages. "Exactly where am I being taken?" Worried, you asked. "Also, what's with the costumes and makeup?"

The nurses smiled kindly. "All in due time, Jon." Softly, the first nurse said. "Your father and Mr Harris made all the arrangements; you are in good hands."

The helicopter ride as long and uncomfortable but we finally landed in front of a hospital in a secluded forest area miles away from the town. I was taken out of the helicopter and carried inside where I was in for a shock. All of the doctors and nurses walking around were rock golems of all shapes and sizes! You even saw a few cat creatures, dragons, and vampires!

"Where am I?!" Startled, I demanded.

A tall rock golem approached me with a kind smile on his face. "You are in Stonehenge Monster Hospital, dear boy." Calmly, he explained. "My name is Dr Cliff Boulder. The cavern you had fallen into is a rock golem nursery where you were mistaken for a baby rock golem."

"What..." Confused, I asked. "That doesn't make sense."

"You were covered in dirt and rocks from your fall and were not moving." Sadly, a feminine voice said. "Baby rock golems do not move when others are near; it is a defense mechanism."

I turned to find a young and slender rock golem in tears approaching me. The doctor smiled motioning her closer. "This is Nurse Clay Pebbles." Calmly, he said. "She fed you the magical cement mixture before realizing you were human." He chuckled. "You can imagine her surprise, not to mention horror when she realized her mistake."

"So you are the one who carried me out?" Wide eyed, I asked.

Clay nodded. "Normally, the magic cement transforms a human immediately and they run in panic, which most time leads them to becoming 'still born'." Regret in her voice, she said. "You were unconscious so..." She gulped. "The transformation took a stable hold. As you were only given one small dose, I thought you might have a chance so..."

"It was foolish of her to make such a rash move." Turning serious, Cliff said. "However, as you survived, she managed to keep her job. Right now, we need to see if this transformation is stable and, if not, we need to stabilize it quickly."

"Can this be reversed?" Hopeful, I asked.

Cliff shook his head. "Sorry but the changes are permanent." Gently, he said. "However, you are the first human in centuries to survive this." He managed a smile. "Our concern is to help you adapt and move on."

With that, I was moved into a room by myself with Clay staying behind after everyone else left.
1111221111121112.title: I go alone.

11112211111211121.content:
I am sooo sorry this happened to you." Wincing, Clay said. "The transition had to have been terrifying."

I gave a short chuckle. "Dr Khan was more terrifying than the transition, I think."

Clay gave a nervous giggle. "I was told about him." Smiling slightly, she said. "His notes suggested he was expecting a Nobel Peace Prize for his research on your condition."

Seeing Clay's discomfort, I decided to change the subject. "What do rock golems eat? I have not been able to really keep anything down but water for a few days now."

Clay smiled. "Rock golems eat various things but you will have to wait until you are given the all clear to eat anything." Kindly, she replied. "You may still be human underneath all of that rocky exterior." She then blushed slightly. "On the bright side, you do make a rather handsome rock golem."

You blushed at that as well. "I have a human girlfriend, sorry."

Clay maintained her smile. "It's okay." Softly, she said.

You sensed she wanted to add something but decided not to press. Instead, you asked, "Are you still on your shift?"

"No, my shift ended about an hour ago." Honestly, Clay replied. "I just wanted to make certain you were okay and were not too angry with me."

"There's no way you could have known." Kindly, I said. "Also, you did give me a fair fighting chance by carrying me out of the woods." You touched her hand, causing her to blush. "Thank you."

Clay smiled shyly. "You are welcome."
11112211111211121.title: Clay and I talk.

111122111112111211.content:
Shortly after, mom and dad hurried into my room, looking concerned. Mom was the first to reach me while dad stood protectively on the other side of the bed. "We wanted to go with you on the flight but there was just enough room for the nurses to work." Tearfully, mom said. "We rushed here as fast as the jeep could carry us."

"I appreciate you coming so quickly." Smiling, I said. I motioned to Clay. "This is Nurse Clay Pebbles, she's the one who rescued me."

Clay blushed in shame but, to her surprise, mom gave her a warm hug. "Thank you for saving my little boy, Clay." Kindly, she said. "Bless you..."

"Um... thank you." blushing more, she said. She then mouthed to me, "Thank you..."

"What happened?" Serious, dad demanded.

"That cave I fell into happened to have been a rock golem nursery." Ruefully, I said. "I landed in an empty mud bed and was knocked out cold. The mud was magical and I ended up swallowing a good bit of it." I again motioned to Clay. "She found that I was human and quickly carried me out to where I could get help."

"Quite right." Startling us, Dr Cliff Boulder said. He introduced himself. "Your son is now a young rock golem but, as you can see, he is not alone in this world. Nurse Pebbles' quick and decisive action saved your son from becoming one of those stone statues you normally find in the forest."

"We are in your debt, Nurse Pebbles." Nodding, dad said.

"I would like to talk to you in the hall, Mr. Que." Serious, Dr. Boulder said. "It's nothing serious but you know how worrisome mothers can get..."

Dad chuckled. "I know all too well."

He excused himself for the moment and walked out. Once he was gone, mom turned to Nurse Pebbles. "I would like to consider you family, if that's okay with you." Softly, she said. "You saved my son..."

Clay began to cry and confessed what had happened to me when I fell into the cave. Mom listened then pulled her into another warm hug. "The mud in the bed was magic, am I correct?"

Clay nodded, still crying. "Yes... it was but..."

Mom hushed her. "The same effect would have likely happened even if you had not fed him more... in fact, that extra little bit may have saved him from becoming a statue for life." She smiled warmly at Clay. "You acted quickly, saving a life... you are a hero."

Now Clay began to cry happy tears and returned mom's hug just as dad and Dr. Boulder returned. "What did we miss?" Worried, dad demanded.

"I have decided to adopt Clay into our family." Firmly, mom replied. "You can fight me on this if you want but I warn you..."

"It's fine..." With a rueful grin, dad said. "I'm not challenging you on this one."

Mom nodded then giggled as Clay whispered, "How do you do that...?"

"Let's just say my husband loves my cooking..."

I smiled at that and turned to Clay. "Welcome to the family... sis."
111122111112111211.title: Your parents arrive to visit.

113.content:
... on a steel table in a high tech lab. I looked around and there was a lot of equipment to be seen, lining up the wall.

Me: Where am I?
???: H-hey, are you okay?

I looked to my left and I saw a young person. He looked to be about 18-19 years of age.

???: My name is Jamie.
Me: ...Jamie.

Suddenly I felt weak. "Jamie" then began to panic.

Jamie: O-oh! NO. Please stay awake (I began to lay down it was easier to stay awake then.) Okay. Youre still okay... Umm... listen... I need to - dont freak out about this - splice your DNA in order to keep you alive. (I was instantly shocked, but I braced myself for what ever happened next) Okay (He takes a needle labled "Antisphetic") I'm going to need ypou to be unconcious for the process. Also whan you wake up you'll find that it will be saturday morning. You will be at your house. Your mother will know of this. You wont be able to see the effects of the DNA change immediately, but give it a few days and well... you'll notice the next day. Anyway one more thing: when yo wake up, just thank DX Labs for the fact that you are still alive, alright?
Me: Okay. I'm not sure how this will all turn out but, okay.

And so I slowly fall asleep.
113.title: DX Labs

choices: You will die (but he can prove them wrong)
Your DNA has been twigged slightly
1131.content:
"You alright there, Jon?" Mom asked gently.

I wanted to nod, but my neck felt unusually stiff. Well, to be precise, my entire body felt terribly stiff. So no, I wasn't alright.

Mom walked towards me before sitting on the edge of my bed and stroking my head comfortingly. "You'll be fine, Jon," She promised. "Give it a day or two, and you'll be as good as new, huh?"

I could tell she was more of trying to reassure herself than me.

"What..." I croaked. "Happened?"

Mom's lower lip trembled, and for the first time, she looked uncertain. "I... don't really know, Jon," she whispered truthfully.

"I remembered... Jamie my surgeon saying he needed to... splice my DNA?" I asked. "Why?"

"I..." Mom hesitated. "Your trip in the forest, wasn't anything ordinary... You know that forest, notorious for its... phenomenas. Apparently, somehow, according to my comprehension, that fall back there you had distorted your DNA transcription site in your system."

"What?"

Mom bit her lip. "They had to splice your DNA back there to replenish that lost 'gene-maker'."

"Are you talking about mutations?" I asked curiously.

She shook her head and furrowed her brow. "No Jon, I'm saying the doctors don't really know whats going on. This is my best guess."

It occurred to me that it hurt from Mom to come clean with me. That reluctance to meet my gaze, her shifty demeanor, and her fidgety fingers told me that something was definitely going on behind all that calmness.

I realized she was probably only telling me half the truth. The other half, she was hiding it from me.

I looked her in the eye, only to have her look away.

"Mom!" I said harshly. "Look me into the eye and tell me the full story! What did the doctor say?"

"The doctor said..." She wrung her hands nervously. "The operation failed, Jon. It... failed..." Her voice broke, and tears welled up in her eyes.

Somehow, I couldn't cry. I wanted to, I really did. But my eyes felt barren, as dry as desert, and not a single tear was produced. Somehow, deep within me, it was as though I had known of my fate all along. Known that the operation would fail. Known that...

"Tell me," I whispered bravely. "I promise I'll be strong."

Mom cried all of the sudden, before saying, "The doctors said that you...

Said that what?
1131.title: Saturday morning (1)

choices: I find I can control the changes.
11311.content:
"The doctors said that your DNA has become dangerously unstable." crying, mom said. "Nine times out of ten, it means that you will die very soon. If not, it might get even worse."

I was crying at this point. "What do you mean worse!?" fearful, I asked. "What's worse than dying!?"

Mom swallowed down a lump before she replied, "One out of ten cases like yours become shape shifters, Jon." barely holding herself together, mom explained. "Even then, all of them go insane or die as they have no idea how to control the changes they go through."

"What sort of changes?" now panicking, I asked.

"Animal changes, son." crying, mom replied. "I've already seen you change twice so... you might prove them wrong but I'm sorry, you'll never be the same again."

With that mom left the room, crying hysterically, leaving me alone, in fear of my fate...
11311.title: You will die (but he can prove them wrong)

113111.content:
And fear for my fate I did. The words die, insane, animal changes were on repeat in my head. How could this be happening to me. Was this some kind of crazy dream. Or sick prank? As these thoughts raced through my mind, I could feel my heartbeat accelerating. And that is when things really got weird.

All of a sudden my body began to feel weird. Indescribably weird. I felt tingles race through my body. My skin felt tight...extremely tight.

"I'm sorry honey," my mom apologized as she re-entered the room. "I should not have..."

The next thing I heard was my mother's blood-curdling scream.

What's going on? I thought. Why is she screaming so loudly. I attempted to reach up and cover my ears with my hands only I couldn't. In fact I couldn't move at all. It was like I was stuck. I heard/felt my clothing ripping. Thoughts were becoming difficult to grasp. And then almost as soon as it started, it stopped. The sensations... the tightness.. it all went away.

Unfortunately Mom was still blubbering. I tried to call out to her only I didn't hear my voice, I heard
113111.title: I start changing at random.

1131113.content:
I tried to call out to her only I didn't hear my voice, I heard was a multiple of voices. It was like a crowd of people talking rather than one. Mom looked at me, still seemingly terrified but at least I got her attention. "I'm scared, mom." Softly, I said.

"You are not alone." Trembling, mom said. "I thought you had suddenly become some kind of monster... I was afraid for you, for myself..." She bowed her head. "What kind of mother am I..."

"You didn't run and you're still not running." Trying to be of comfort, I said. "I'd say you are a brave and caring mother."

Mom smiled at that, tears falling from her eyes. "Thank you." She sighed. "At times like this, I would turn to my cat to calm my nerves..."

I nodded, knowing that mom missed her cat, Jitters. I tried to speak more comfort to her but all that came out was a meow. I looked about, startled and found that everything was now huge... looking at myself, I found that I had become an exact copy of our old cat, Jitters. "How about that..." Surprised, I thought. "I can now change into animals."

Knowing mom still needed comforting, I leaped up onto her lap and began to purr at her while stroking my head against her chin. Mom's surprise slowly turned into a form of bemusement as she began to pet me. The sensation of being petted felt pretty good and I somehow wanted it to last. Before I knew it, I had fallen asleep in her lap. When I later woke up...
1131113.title: Animal chorus

114.content:
When I woke up, what seemed like hours later, I found myself lying in a large bed inside an old shack somewhere. I threw the covers off of myself to find that my shirt was missing and that my sides had been wrapped in gauze. Trying to get up, I felt a sharp pain in my side and laid back down, moaning. "What happened to me?" I wondered. the last thing I remember was falling into that hole in the woods."

Deciding I had to find where I was, I miserably forced myself to roll out of the bed and get onto my feet. That proved to be a bad idea as the room lurched around me and I was forced to hang onto the bed to keep myself from falling onto the floor from the dizziness I was feeling. "Is anyone here!?" I called out, weakly. "Hello!?"

Hanging on to whatever I could, I staggered out of the room to find that the old shack had a living room and open kitchen with a hall in between to the left that you guessed lead to a laundry room and a bathroom. what unnerved you was that all the windows were boarded up, allowing in no sun light so it was impossible to determine if it was day or night out. I looked about and found a door I hoped would lead me outside and opened it to find the shack was inside a cave!

"Okay, this is creepy." I said to myself, looking about the cave. "Who would live in a cave?"

Hearing voices from above, I looked up to to find the hole I had fallen from and hurried to it, hoping to attract someone's attention and be rescued. Only, upon reaching where I had landed, I froze in horror as I found...
114.title: Inside an old shack.

1141.content:
"No!" I whispered hoarsely. "No! No! NO!!!"

I stood there, stunned, looking over my lifeless and broken body on the floor of the cave as it looked up, unaware, at the hole it had fallen through only hours before. Only, as my rational thoughts took hold again, I realized that my dead body was not wrapped in bandages as I was. "What the hell?" I asked.

"Get back in." came a voice.

I turned around to find yet another surprise, I was facing my late grandmother, Grace! "Impossible." I said softly. "You died over ten years ago!"

Grace nodded. "You died a few hours ago, hence you can see." she said, her voice echoing slightly. "I bandaged you up with medical supplies from this realm, the doorway to the next life. "I am the imaginary friend to a little girl somewhere." she giggled. "But to the point, you need to get back to your body before the ties between your soul and your body completely sever and you are forced to join me."

"How do I do that?" I asked. "I've never been... dead before."

Grace laughed. "You are one of the rare few who will experience it twice, Jon." she said. "However, as I have mended the ties that bind your soul to your body, you will soon be able to become a ghost at will and return to the living when you are ready to join them again."

I swallowed hard and tried to ask Grace for more answers but she lightly placed a finger onto my lips. "We will have plenty of time to talk later." she said. "Just lay down and line up your body with that one on the ground. Your body will do the rest and you will wake up. Good luck, Jon."

With that, Grace vanished from sight and I quickly placed myself against my dead body, placing myself in the same position, as I was told. I did not have long to wait as I felt myself being pulled into the other body and I again blacked out. It was hours later when I woke up, this time to find myself...
1141.title: My body!

choices: I start to see dead people.
11411.content:
I woke up to the beep beep beep of a vitals monitoring machine and slowly opened my eyes to find mom looking over me with a worried look on her face. "Jon, can you hear me?" she asked.

"Ask if the woman is okay." came a voice in my head.

"Huh?" I asked, confused.

"Jon, say something." said mom, moving her face closer. I could see she had been crying.

"Ask her if the woman is okay, Jon." came Grace's voice. "Do you want to get the riot act later?"

Finally understanding that grandma Grace was still with me and trying to help, I responded, "Is the woman okay?"

Mom gave me an odd look. "Woman?"

I nodded. "I heard a woman screaming, in the woods, on my way to school." I explained. "I ran to help and..."

Mom nodded. "You fell into the sink hole." she finished. "I told you those woods were dangerous. People have heard far worse sounds coming from it." she sighed. "No, the search teams did not find any woman, just you."

I teared up slightly. "I just wanted to help her." I said.

"I'm proud of you for that." said mom. she kissed my forehead. "We will speak no further of this, I'm just happy that you are still alive."

"For the most part, anyway." you thought.

Grace giggled inside your mind. "This is just the beginning, Jon." she said, in my thoughts. "You will find your life far more interesting from here on in."
11411.title: In a hospital bed.

choices: another something to prove he can see ghost
114111.content:
Creepy was a major understatement.

I suppose it simply wasn't a normal occurance to have your Grandma ranting in your ears - especially if she um, was supposed to have departed for Heaven, like, ten years ago? I was crept out, sure, but after dying, having an absolutely normal conversation with a dead person, and then resurrecting, I could proudly declare that nothing else could surprise me from this day onwards.

Until that boy 'materialized' before me..

"I'm on the bed," was the first sentenced he uttered to me. Ever. I didn't even know that dude.

Nice introductory line. So... How do I introduce myself then? : I'm on the bed too?

"Sorry?" I asked instead, perturbed by his skeletal structure.

The boy surveyed me nervously. "I'm on the bed," He repeated again, as though trying to convince himself so.

"No," I replied, feeling crazily ridiculous. "Sorry to disappoint, but you're errr... standing on the, um, floor, in my ward btw..."

He stared at me, as though horrified that I had spoken the unspeakable. Then he snapped out of his daze, and gave himself a full body scan. (I mean, who did that sort of thing?) Gingerly, fearfully, he reached out and poked himself. (I was starting to think that that guy belonged with the loons.) And finally, his hands shaking like a boat in on choppy waters, he recoiled it sharply.

"You alright?" I questioned, concerned now.

The boy looked as though he'd seen a ghastly ghost.

"Hey," I waved my uninjured hand in front of his dazed face. Multitasking, I used the other to point at the empty seat previously occupied by my Mom. "Don't faint on me," I advised. "Just settle there and... you know, chill out...?"

The boy followed my orders robotically.

I was revising my social skills in my head - to start some small talk of course- when the door flung open, revealing a girl my age with a water cart.

She barely acknowledged me with a lazy tilt of her head, completely ignored the 'I'm-on-the-bed' boy (I don't know his name), and carted the water cart in.

"Pleased to meet you too," I muttered sarcastically.

"Heard ya, kid," She scowled in my direction.

I decided I didn't really like her. From her uniform, she was a hundred and one percent, undoubtedly, a candy-striper. Ugh, the standard has deproved drastically. Can't they hire some better kids?

"The idiot din't even bother to acknowledge me," The 'I'm-on-the-bed-boy' finally decided to join the conversation. "What am I, a ghost?"

The girl didn't even bother to act like she heard it. It was as though... he hadn't spoken? It started to get me jittery. This girl could either a) act amazingly well - pretending not to have heard a thing, b) really didn't hear, or c) was being her usual idiotic self. Option c seemed the most likely.

Wow, this one really had an attitude problem.

"Yeah," I piped up loudly towards the 'I'm-on-the-bed-boy'. "I totally agree. Let's sign a petition to get her sacked."

'I'm-on-the-bed-boy' nodded in quick staccato nods, looking enthusiastic at the idea.

I grinned. We'd finally caught her attention. The girl's eyes immediately snapped up incredulously from her job, to study me skeptically. Her eyebrows raised itself on it's own accord, and she murmured, "Whoa, you're in a worse condition than I imagined."

"What?"

"Talking to an imaginary friend," She snickered at me outrightly. "Either you're really desperate for one, or really just a nutcase."

"WHAT?" 'I'm-on-the-bed-boy' hollered, jumping to his feet and lunging at her in a flurry. "What do you mean-" His hands slid right through her. No, not around. But THROUGH. It was... gross. However, at the moment, the only thing that flashed through my mind was: Oh. My. Gosh.

'I'm-on-the-bed-boy' screamed in horror, doubling back into me, and yeah, zipping right through me like a bullet.

It was my turn to scream.

Mean girl nearly dropped the water jar. She frowned at me for a single puzzled moment, before glancing at the ceiling, expecting it to fall and squish us, or something. When nothing exciting happened, she glanced back at me.

"What's your problem, sissy kid?" She demanded. "Even my younger sis ain't that sissy."

Deep breaths, I convinced myself. Deep breaths. So... she hadn't witnessed the whole 'stick-my-hand-through-your-body' stunt? She... couldn't see 'I'm-on-the-bed-boy'? But I could!

So naturally, I just freaked out.
114111.title: I start to see dead people.

114112.content:
As I laid there in the hospital bed, I wondered what grandma Grace meant by her words when I hard my mom's voice in my head, causing me to jump. *He is going to make me gray before my time, scaring me like that!*

"I didn't mean to scare you, mom." I said, causing her to jump. "I'm sorry."

*How did he know what I was thinking?* mom forced a smile. "It's alright, Jon." she replied. "You get some rest."

"How did I know what she was thinking?" I thought, curious.

Then Grace's voice entered my mind as well. "You are hearing her spirit." she explained. "You can not see it, as you see me, as it is still one with her Earthly shell."

"Then... I can see dead people!?" I thought to her, turning pale.

Grace gigged, appearing before me. "Anyone can see dead people, Jon." she said. "Only you, due to your condition, an see and hear a person's spirit, hear what the spirit of a live person is thinking." with a sad sigh, she added. "However, like people, there is good and evil among spirits... be careful who you allow to approach you."

"Can they really hurt me, if I can see them?" I asked, whispering.

Grace shook her head. "Not physically but they can attack your spirit or worse, possess your body while you are not occupying it to claim a physical body of their own." she told you. "The spirit world is just as dangerous as the world of the living, I will help you all I can but you must remain alert."

I nodded as Grace then vanished and other voices began to reach my ears. They were all out in the halls and, fortunately, not entering the room. Still, I was curios.

What am I to do?
114112.title: I start hearing voices.

choices: The spirit of a child visits me.
1141121.content:
Remembering grandma's warning that other spirits could 'hijack' my physical body, I did not want to take the chance of leaving it in a hospital. That turned out to be a good decision as I saw many spirits pass the room moments later. Some of them peered in and gave me a longing, almost envious look. I came to realize then that many of the recently dead remained in the hospital for a while because they did not want to die. I suspected some would be desperate enough to take another person's body just to taste the 'sweet' breath of life once again. It was also wise of me not to acknowledge their looks as it would have tipped them off that I could see them and I was not yet ready to deal with that.

"I need to get out of here." panicked, I whispered. "This place is giving me the creeps."

"It's okay, honey." said mom, looking at my half open eyes. "You're dreaming, go back to sleep. You need your rest."

I did not know how I could rest, with the ability I now possessed. I decided that I would have to do some research before I try anything. "Look before you leap." I whispered. "That's what grandma used to always say."

As I slowly drifted back to sleep, I wondered where I should begin to discover who or what I had become...
1141121.title: Stay where I am.

11411212.content:
I woke up a few hours later to see a small girl, well the ghost of a small girl, staring at me from the hall. Unfortunately, I was half awake and smiled as I caught her eye. "Hello." not realizing she was a ghost yet, I said. "Are you lost?"

The girl looked at me as if I had startled her then floated over to me, which was when I realized she was a ghost. "You- You can see me?" tearing up, the girl asked. "I thought I was dead as no one talked to me."

I sighed at the little girl, feeling sorry for her as she did not yet realize the gravity of her situation. Not that I could blame her, the girl looked to be no older that five or six years old. "What is your name?" hoping to be gentle, I asked.

"Maya Jennings." shyly, the girl replied. "Who are you?"

"I am Jon Que." sitting up, I said. "Can you tel me why you are at the hospital?"

"I dunno." shrugging her shoulders, Maya replied. "I woke up here and got up to see my body, lying in a bed with wires hooked on it." sobbing a little, she added, "I got scared and ran off to find someone to help me but no one would look at me or even listen so I tried to go back to my body... it wasn't there anymore."

Maya sobbed more, shivering and I guessed I did not have much time before she would be a ghost permanently and tried to think of a way to help her. Finally, an idea came to me and I jumped from my own body and took a hold of her hand, startling her. She looked at me uncertain weather to trust me or run away. "You look cold." smiling at her, I said. "Please, let me help you."

Still uncertain, Maya slowly nodded and I pulled her into my own body. It felt strange allowing a ghost to possess me but I could almost feel her blushing. "You're warm." her voice whispering into my ear, she said. "Thank you but I need my own body."

"I'm going to help you find it." staggering out of bed, I whispered. "Only I am a patient here too so I have to be careful not to be caught. The doctors and nurses really don't like their patients to just wander anywhere."

"Where do we start?" curious, Maya asked.

"Did you look to see which room you were in?" hopeful, I asked. "That would be where I would start."

Does Maya know the room she was in?
11411212.title: The spirit of a child visits me.

114112122.content:
Maya shook her head. "Uh... no, I don't." she said.

"Then I'm guessing you looked into the wrong room when you went back to look for your body." sighing, I said. "Were you on this floor when you ran to get help?"

"Yes, I was." curious, Maya said. "Why?"

"There are only so many rooms on each floor." trying to sound confident, I replied. "We'll simply peek into every room until we find your body."

"Oh. You're really smart, Jon." in a happier tone, Maya said.

I tried not to blush at that as I slowly walked down the hall, looking into each room, hoping to find the girl quickly before I was caught and sent back to my own room or worse, I meet another ghost....
114112122.title: No.

choices: "Why Do you live in a Cave?"
"What's up with the hair, and the clothes, and the eyes? They're freaky"
1143.content:
Crouching in front of me was a man, appearing to be in his mid twenties, wiping up what appeared to be blood, left from when I fell from the whole. The man appeared to be strangely well dressed for someone who lived in shack that was also inside of a cave. He was wearing a pair of black slacks, a white button down shirt, and a black vest, yeah way to fancily dressed for a man who lives in a cave, what was even stranger was the man's hair color. Short feathery locks of pure white framed his face, the man must have heard me coming since before I knew it, I was looking directly into two purple orbs bearing a big, pointy-toothed, grin. "Oh, I see you're up, that wasn't long at all, I thought you'd be out much longer, I mean that was a pretty high fall," the man said. The man slowly stood up, and I nearly fell back onto my butt, the man simply towered over me. The man had a bloody rag in hand as he walked closer, gently placing a hand on my fore head. His hand was as cold as ice, no warmth in it, I couldn't say anything, I couldn't even move, I've never been so scared in my life. "Hmm you're still very feverish, why don't you go lay back down while I finish cleaning up?" he asked, still smiling, though I felt that I'd never trust that smile for as long as I lived.

I didn't say a word, the man just stared at me, his smile turning into a confused frown, he waved his hand in front of my eyes. "Hello? Anybody there? If you're not going to do it yourself, I could always carry you back to the bedroom," he threatened.

I finally shook out of my daze and stumbled back from the tall male, "N-no, I-I can do it," I stuttered, my eyes locked onto his. The male chuckled, smiling again, messing up my hair, before walking back into the boarded up shack, I took one last glance at the hole, before I turned around and followed the white haired male. He disappeared down the hall, to the laundry room I assumed. I looked around, but I found there was no place to run off to. Defeated I turned to the bedroom and slowly walked inside, I decided that I would just have to do what the man said, I was wounded, and I was in no condition to run away. I grunted as I sat down on bed, holding onto my side.

It was a few good minutes before the man returned, the man actually having duck through the doorway as he entered the bedroom. He shook his head, "That's not laying down," he said as he moved closer, I tried to argue as the man lowered me down to the bed, but I could only hiss in pain, my injuries still haven't healed. "Just relax, I'm not going to hurt you, I promise," he told me. I laid there, obviously uncomfortable, as he pulled up a chair and sat down. "My name's Cecil Morpheus Von Haeide, and unfortunately for you, you have three broken ribs, and a fractured wrist," he smirked. "It's not often I get visitors falling from the sky, well actually, this would be the first time I've ever had that happen, but still. Anyway what were you doing in the forest Anyway?" I remained silent, I was going to die before I'd give the man a single bit of information to work with. The man frowned again, "Not the talkative type huh, will you at least tell me your name?" I shook my head. He sighed in defeat, "Well since none of my questions have been working, how about you ask me a question, go on, ask anything."

I thought for a bit before I finally opened my mouth and asked...
1143.title: I was not alone...

11431.content:
Cecil smiled kindly. "I believe 'what was I' would be a more appropriate question." with a bemused look, he said. "I have been dead for nearly two hundred years."

"So you are a ghost then?" curious, I asked. Cecil nodded. "Then how did you..."

Cecil chuckled. "I didn't; Mark did." smiling sadly, he replied. "He sensed that you were special somehow and brought you here to be treated." he gave another sigh. "If he had not, you would have died where you had landed." pausing, he asked, "May I now have your name?"

"I- I'm Jon, Jon Que." shivering slightly, I said. "Is Mark here? I think I should at least thank him for saving my life."

"You're welcome." came a soft voice.

I turned and gasped, seeing a tall and slender boy step up behind Cecil. At least he resembled a boy. His skin was a dark, almost tree bark color. His ears were misshapen, looking more like dark leaves, with blood red lips, deep green eyes, and short dirt blond hair. His right arm seemed normal but his left arm looked like it had been replaced with a long thorny vine with large spike like thorns for fingers on his hand.

"Good gracious!" my eyes wide with shock, I exclaimed. "What happened to you!?"

Mark smiled, his blood red lips not opening as he stifled a soft laugh. "I was born this way." simply, he replied. "It is something not of my choosing but I like who I am."

Cecil cleared his throat, catching my attention. "Mark here is a Mandrake; a human/plant hybrid." to my shock, he explained. "Only, unlike the inaccurate legends of old, Mark is quite powerful as he is wields the power of an ecomancer, the ability to control plant life."

"I- I'll take you- your word for it." frightened, I said. "Um... Cecil said you sensed I was... special?"

Mark nodded. "You are special but, I fear, not in the way you might think." almost sadly, he replied.

"How exactly do you believe I am special?" curious, I asked. I then winced and quickly added, "Not that I'm ungrateful or anything like that..."

Mark chuckled. "Relax, it's fine." calmly, he said. "I do not know exactly what makes you special, its a just a feeling and I have learned not to ignore such feelings when I get them."

"I see...." gulping, I said. "Well, as soon as I am able to travel, I should get myself home."

"That won't be for a while, my dear boy." firmly but kindly, Cecil said. "We can not, in good conscious, let you walk away from here in the condition you are in."

"It's a long climb to the surface." wincing, Mark said. "It's difficult for a healthy person, impossible for one as injured as you are."

"My mother is going to be worried sick." groaning, I said. "If I make it out of here, she'll 'kill' me for taking a shortcut through the woods."

"Is that all you were doing up there?" came a soft feminine voice.

Surprised, I strained my head to look passed Cecil and Mark to see a young girl, no older than ten or twelve standing by the door. She had light, almost stone colored skin with long brown hair that had curious green highlights and deep set blue eyes. She wore a long, loose fitting black dress with heavy black boots. She was very cute and seemed rather shy. "I thought you were running from someone." blushing, the girl said. she rose a dainty hand to her mouth, quivering with a certain sadness. "My bad, sorry."

"You made the ground give way under me?" stunned, I asked.

The girl teared up, stifling a sob. "I said I was sorry." looking hurt, she said.

Jon, this Viva." motioning to the small girl, Cecil said. "She is a young..."
11431.title: "What Are You?"

114311.content:
Viva sobbed slightly, looking at me with tears running down her smooth face. "Are you mad at me?"

I sighed, not knowing what to say. Sure I was mad but how could a little girl cause the ground to give way below me? Even if she could, how could I be mad at someone so cute and innocent looking. Viva took a step closer, her eyes searching for an answer. "No, I am not mad at you." with a sigh, I said. "I'm sure you were only trying to help."

Viva gave a little excited scream of delight and hurried over to the bed. Each step she made seemed to shake the house, causing me to give out a yelp in fright. Mark smiled at her excited relief. "Easy, Viva." laughing, he said. "You're shaking the whole house."

Viva stopped at the bed, throwing Mark an annoyed look. "I can't help it." pouting, she said.

"She has limited control over the ground around her." calmly, Cecil explained. "It reacts to her emotions and mental state. She feared you were running from someone so the ground reacted, giving you an escape from your unknown pursuer."

"Then it wasn't on purpose." managing a smile, I said. "You did nothing wrong, Viva."

Viva looked at me with her eyes sparkling with a certain fear and wonder. "I- I've never met a kind human before." staring at me, she whispered. "Are there more like you?"

"He's not quite human." darkly, Mark said. "He just does not realize it yet."

"Exactly what do you think I am, if I'm 'not quite' human?" irritated, I asked. "I don't remember seeing anything unusual about myself lately."

"Your condition is not as noticeable as Mark or Viva." chiming in, Cecil said. "Also, you were not born with what you have." he shook his head, looking sad. "I fear you were cursed with it."

"Cursed?" confused, I asked. "By what, who?" I struggled to sit up. "Please, you are all scaring me right now... tell me what you think I am!"

Mark sighed, raising his thorny vine like arm. "Viva, please leave the room." serious, he said. "If I am right or wrong, you will not want to see this."
114311.title: rock golem.

1143111.content:
Albeit reluctantly, Viva quietly walked out of the room. Mark gave her a nod and slowly closed the door. "She is very young." turning to me, Mark explained. "We don't want to give her nightmares."

Before I could react, Mark viciously swung his vine like thorny arm onto my bandages. I screamed, more in fright than pain, seeing the bandages rip wide open. "I could not believe my eyes when I saw you." serious, Mark said. "However, as you can see, you are more than a mere human."

Shaking, I looked at my body under the bandages and gasped at what I saw. "What... is... this!?!" my lips trembling, I asked. "What happened to me!?!"

Under the bandages, through the slash in my upper abdomen, I saw what could only have been described as dozens of small rocks and vines moving about inside of me! "This is how we found you, Jon." serious, Cecil said. "When I talked to you outside of the cabin earlier, I got the feeling that you had no clue."

"What... am... I?" tearing up, I asked.

Mark sighed. "We fear that either Viva, I, or both accidentally scratched you." darkly, he replied. "If that is so, you will be just like her or me within a few days time." he shook his head. "I'm sorry but you will not be human anymore when the changes are finished."

This proved to be too much for me and I fainted...
1143111.title: What am I!?!

11431111.content:
I woke up, what seemed like hours, later to find myself in a spacious bedroom. It had all the markings of a modern colonial home with a spacious walk in closet to my left, large windows on my right, though they looked out into the cave, a dresser between the two windows, and a couch against the far wall with a coffee table in front of it. Not far from the closet was a closed door I guessed was the way out.

"I must have fainted." rubbing my eyes, I muttered. "But where am I now?"

Then, I heard some soft, approaching footsteps echoing from beyond the door, followed by the inaudible metallic click of the door unlocking. I had a visitor. I jumped out of bed to find that I was now wearing clean pajamas. "What!?" surprised, I whispered.

There was no time to ponder over it, however, my new host was at the door and I felt the need to confront whoever it was. Not knowing who my host was or how many there were, I quickly positioned myself behind the opening door to gain the advantage of surprise.

"I'm ready for you!" I thought. "Come on in!"

I waited, motionless, muscles tightening, preparing myself for who ever my host might have been. I hoped it was the same people who I had met earlier but experience taught me to be on guard when I wake up in a strange place. The door swung inward, hiding my form, and a small girl cautiously entered, leaving the door open behind her. She was carrying a small key in one hand and balancing a silver tray holding a pitcher of water, a tall glass and a few sandwiches in the other. She stuffed the key into her dress pocket then took the tray into both hands and continued to carefully walk into the room. "Jon?" she asked softly. "Are you awake?"

I gave out an inaudible sigh, seeing Viva. I pushed the door away from me but I guess I did not know my own strength as the door slammed closed, the sound echoing in the room. Viva stiffened, paralyzed with fear. For a second, I thought there was going to be an earthquake, remembering that the ground reacts to her emotions. "I'm right behind you." softly, I said. "Sorry if I startled you, I did not mean to slam the door."

Viva turned around slowly, her hands trembling. "Do- Do you remember me?" looking frightened, she asked. "We met the other day."

I wondered why Viva was scared I would not remember her but waved it off. "I remember you, Viva." managing a smile, I said. "Tell me, where are my clothes and why was the door locked?"

"Your clothes are being washed, they were dirty." smiling slightly, Viva replied. "The door was locked so you could sleep in peace, it unlocks easily from the inside, silly."

I gave a nervous chuckle, blushing slightly, causing Viva to giggle. "I brought you some water and snacks in case you were hungry." she said. "It's peanut butter and jelly. I prefer topsoil and worms."

I winced at that then remembered that Viva was a rock golem, they must not eat like humans do. Strangely, the mention of her favorite food seemed to make my mouth water a little. "I-I'll take the peanut butter and jelly, please." smiling, I said. "Can you tell me where we are? This can't be the shack I woke up in earlier."

"No, the shack is for new arrivals and intruders." shaking her head, Viva said. "This is the main house, its too deep into the cave for any human to find and make his way out. It's where we all live."

"You mean there are more of you?" curious, I asked.

Viva giggled. "Of course, you silly willy." placing the tray onto the coffee table, she said. "There are six of us, counting Cecil." she smiled at me. "You make seven, a lucky number."

I could not help smile at that and took up one of the sandwiches. Viva gasped and opened her mouth to speak but I had already taken a bite. The sandwich had a gritty and gooey taste to it but it was not half bad. "Do you guys make your own peanut butter and jelly?" after swallowing, I asked. "It tastes a bit off but its still pretty good."

Viva laughed, holding her sides. "That was one of my sandwiches, topsoil and worms!" still laughing, she said. she composed herself and wiped away a tear from laughter. "Do you really like it?"

My eyes widened, realizing what I had just taken a bit of and swallowed down. I looked at the sandwich and nearly choked, seeing that the worms were still moving! "Um... I..." stammering, I said. then I blushed brightly and sighed. "It... wasn't... half bad."

Viva laughed again as the door to the room opened. "How is our patient doing, Viva?" asked an unfamiliar voice. "Is he able to move about?"

I turned, still blushing, to find....
11431111.title: I wake up later.

114311112.content: What walked into the door was unlike anything I had ever seen before except maybe in a nightmare or some old horror film. It was a....
114311112.title: something... someone else.

1143111121.content:
She was tall and dark, looked to be about eighteen, perhaps of far eastern decent with long silver hair and red eyes that seemed almost hypnotic. She stood on eight, yes, eight powerful legs which one would think was her most unusual feature. At first glance, I thought she was a Dridder, a human/spider hybrid. However, that definition somehow did not seem to fit her. I did not see anything that looked like a spider's abdomen but a human one. It was as if she had an ill formed Siamese twin and she was using her arms and legs with her own two to move about. Even more, there was a certain hunger in her eyes that caused me to want to turn away but I could not. I found myself staring, trying to figure out exactly who or what had entered the room.

"Hello, Yoko." smiling, Viva said. "Jon seems to be doing better than yesterday." she giggled before adding, "He even ate one of my topsoil and worm sandwiches."

Yoko rose a single eyebrow, turning to me. "He ate the entire sandwich?" surprised, she asked.

I blushed, trying my best to look away. "It wasn't too bad." softly, I muttered.

"What is wrong...Jon?" darkly, Yoko asked. "Does my appearance frighten or appall you?"

"No, no." quickly, I replied. "It's just I never saw a real Dridder before.

Yoko gave a low giggle. "I'm not a Dridder." smiling slightly, she replied. "I am a Tsuchigumo, there is a difference between the two."

"You- You're a what?" confused, I asked.

"A Sue- chi- gum- o." emphasizing the syllables, Yoko said. "I am from Japan. A dridder is literally half human and half spider where a Tsuchigumo is a 'human' with the characteristics of a spider."

"Yoko can make silk, like a real spider, but it comes from her hair." turning to me, Viva explained. "Also, she has a ven -um -is bite."

"That's venomous." tapping one foot, Yoko corrected. "I can speak for myself, thank you." she then turned to me. "I give everyone here the same warning; if you want to stay alive, stay out of my room."

"I do not know where your room is." meekly, I replied.

"He got you there, Yoko." laughing, Viva said.

"Oh hush or I'll bite you." impatient, Yoko hissed.

"You'll only hurt your teeth." folding her arms over her chest, Viva countered. she childishly stuck out her tongue to make her point.

I struggled not to laugh as Yoko sighed. "My room is on the opposite end of the hall from yours." pointing out the door, she said. "No one goes in there but me unless you wish to be eaten. Is that clear, Jon?"

"Yeah, its clear." quickly, I said.
