1321.content:
I laid back on my bed as Rex sat next to me. I was thinking on what I should do next, until I heard mom open the door and carry a stack of pancakes inside.

"Tom, I heard from your father that you're finally growing up! So, I brought your breakfast up here, so you won't scare your brother." mom said, setting the pancakes on by desk.

"Heheh, thanks mom!"

I just looked at the pancakes and I felt my stomach gurgle, the yummy scent filling my mind!

"Your father also said that your body will need a lot of energy when transforming, so you'll be hungrier than usual. That's why I made a few extras for today."

I merely nodded as I kept eying the food. Mom gave me a knife and fork she brought up with her before I began chowing down. And man, was it delicious! In fact, I just kept scarfing everything down! It was just so good, and before I know it, I was already done. I looked at the empty plate, then back to mom, looking at me sternly.

"Tom, where were your manners!?" she said with an angry tone.

"Um...Sorry?" I said weakly.

"Well, alright then. But I expected you to at least slow down. You could've choked on it, you know."

Without another word, she cleaned up my mess and headed back downstairs. I just blinked as I though about what mom just said.

"Huh. Strange, was I really that hungry? Rex, I wasn't that crazy, was I?"

I looked at Rex, who just curled around on my bed, watching me. I shrugged my shoulders as I stood up, wanting to stretch a bit. I walked up to the door and looked around. No one outside my room. That's good. I looked at the door frame, then felt a powerful urge to scratch it. So, I did. It was just a tiny little scratch, something no one would notice. But then, I just started scratching it more and more, and my claw marks were becoming more pronounced each time. It felt good for some reason, leaving my mark outside my door. That way, everyone would see it. They will know that this room is mine. My territory, my property...I just kept scratching that one spot, until my claw marks were clearly defined on the door frame. I felt proud about my work, until I heard someone coughing. It felt like I woke up from a daze, only to see my dad standing there.

"I see that you've marked your territory, son." he said, looking at the door frame.

I looked at it myself, and for the first time realized what I just did. I felt ashamed, making a huge mark on the door frame like that.

"D-dad! I can explain!" I said quickly, but I really had no explanation to give.

"That's okay son, I understand. Your wolf senses are starting to come out. It's only natural for you to mark your territory. You'll begin acting like this more and more as you transform, and you'll learn to cope with them afterwards."

Dad just gave me a warm smile as he inspected the damage I did. I still felt a little guilty, but knew I couldn't fix it. I sighed as I just went back to my room and laid down next to Rex. I looked down at my pajama legs and realized that my feet have changed the same way my hands did. Did it happen while I was clawing at the door? Oh well, I just hope that it'll end soon.
1321.title: Mom comes in after hearing the news.

choices: We both go looking for them.
We both just kinda hang out for a while.
13211.content:
I gave a little yawn as I curled up on my bed. And the next thing I knew, Rex was licking my face.

"Rex, leave me alone..."

When I realized I fell asleep, I sat upright on my bed. I looked at the clock, seeing that it was already noon. I slept for an extra 3 hours this morning! I got up and stretched again, wondering what I should do. Rex was whining at me, which must mean that he needed to go use the tree outside. So I opened my bedroom door, and he ran out immediately.

"Hey! Rexxy, where are ya goin'?"

That was Scott, my little brother! Why he was upstairs is beyond me, though. Usually, he's downstairs watching TV. I closed the door and took a good look at myself. Other than the changes that have happened already, nothing seemed to have changed. That was until I checked my face, and found out I have brown fur all over me from the neck down. I look like I grew a beard of fur!

"Hey Tom! Aren't we going out today? Come on, you promised!"

Oh no, I remembered! I promised my little bro that we'd go to the park on the first day of summer, which is today!

"Um...*cough* S-sorry Scott, but...Ugh, I don't feel so good." I said.

"Oh...Well, okay then..."

I heard his footsteps moving away, and I was glad...Wait, I heard his footsteps? I pulled my hands up to my ears, and felt that they were pointed now! And there was some fur growing all over it, and they were moving up my head too! They stopped on top of my head, so I now had wolf ears! I can't believe the changes were happening this fast. For one, I am glad that they don't hurt at all. So far, the worst thing that's happened is that they itch a little. I scratch my chest, feeling another itch there. But my hands felt fur underneath my clothes, which must mean that my whole body is covered in fur now! I think the last thing to change would be my face.

I just laid on my bed, waiting for the change to come, but it didn't. I looked outside my window, seeing a number of people pass by my house for personal reasons. I sighed, waiting for my still-human face to change. I then heard footsteps outside my door.

"Tom, I wanna play!" Scott said from beyond the door.

"Ugh, Scott! I told you, I don't feel good!

"You sound fine to me."

Before I could reply, the door handle turned as Scott stepped into my room. He looked at me, and just stared at me. Then, my face started to tingle. I pull a hand/paw up and feel fur growing over it, covering it. Then my mouth and nose pull forward, forming a snout on my face. My teeth even feel weird, like they're changing too. And right then and there, I was done. Scott just stared at me, obviously surprised at what he's seeing.

"Uh...So...Y-yeah..." was all I could say.

"You're a werewolf? That's so cool!"

Scott suddenly runs up to me and starts asking me stuff like how did I get bit, or if it hurt, and other questions I didn't quite catch.

"Okay, okay, Scott. Stop. Stop!" I said, holding my hands out.

"Wait, where's your tail?"

We suddenly heard this ripping sound, so I looked behind me to see my new wolf tail sticking out of a ripped hole from my pants.

"*sigh* I wonder how I'm gonna explain this to mom and dad." I said.
13211.title: Little Brother Scott

132111.content: We both decide to find and ask mom and dad how we should deal with my tail. Their cars are still in the driveway so they are still home. "Hey, Tom? How does having a tail feel like? I honk it would be pretty cool." Scott says with a smile. I look on him happily and say, "It eels reird Scrott." Hmm, that didn't sound right. A little worried, I rushed to the bathroom, noting that I was hunching over, almost like I was ready to run on all fours. When I saw my face in the bathroom mirror, I saw the reason my speech was a little warped. My mouth was becoming a muzzle, and my tongue was a little longer and a bit rougher. I said a few more words to see how warped my speech would be once the change was complete. "Heroh? Ry ame ris Tome. Ry ron't hur' rou." Heh, seems the cartoons got at least one thing right. If a dog or a wolf can speek the human tongue, some of the words will either have a letter taken off, or a letter added on, mostly r's. Luckily, I could understand myself pretty clearly. When I came out, I saw Scott petting Rex. "Ah, hello Tom, dear chap. Thank you so very much indeed for letting me out to, how you say, escort Elvis out of the building, hmm? And it seems you are becoming a werewolf. Oh I heard you and your father's conversation yesterday. A fine being indeed, strong, noble, and quite the scholar." A voice said. I was confused. It didn't sound like Scott. "Rey Scrott, rhy are ya talkring 'Ike rhat?" I said in my slurred speech. "But Tom. I didn't say nothin'." Scott said innocently. Hmm then who was it? Not a moment later, I got my answer. "Down here, ol' boy. Surprised, hmm? Don't be. You are an animal. I wager it is safe to say that wether you masquerade as a wolf or a human you can understand any species. Now I can finally have a middle man to start conversation with the rest of the family. Of course, your father could understand me, but that's because he has both wolf blood and is at least 27. Don't ask me why that's the magic number, ask your old man's mother. Now, you seem to be looking for your parents, yes? Come, I shall take you to them." Rex says rambling a bit. I was shocked to say the least. I half expected to be able to understand animals, but I was a bit surprised when I heard Rex speek like a perfect English gentleman, er gentledog. Scott and I looked at each other, shrugged, and followed Rex. When Rex stopped, we were standing in front of...
132111.title: Heroh?

13211111.content:
Rex led us to the kitchen, where mom was washing dishes, apparently their eaten brunch. Rex faced us and smiled.

"Well, here we are, chaps. I trust that you will strike up conversation with your mother, so I will leave you to it. Fare well, ol' boys!"

Rex then walked away, heading to the back door. Scott ran to mom's side and tugged at her sleeve, trying to get her attention.

"Mom! Mom! Tom is a werewolf! He looks cool, but he's started talking weird!" he said.

I watched as mom turned her attention to him and listened to his words before setting the dish down on the sink and turning to face me. I kinda expected her to scream, or at least jump a little, but she kept a perfectly straight face when she saw me. When I think about it, maybe it's from experience being with my dad's family. Either way, she smiled when she saw me.

"Ah, Tom! You look like you've finished changing. How are you, dear? Tired? Hungry?"

I felt my stomach grumble lightly. I placed a hand on it as I turned to the wall clock, which showed that it was nearing one o'clock.

"Ry'm gretting a rittle rungry." I said.

"Well, I'll set up some lunch for you. Just sit at the table, it'll be ready in a moment."

As I sat down, I saw dad walk in, briefcase in hand and putting a necktie on. He looked like he was in a hurry.

"Hey, honey. Gotta go to work. Boss said Jay called in sick, so I gotta fill in."

"Oh, dear, I thought we were going to enjoy some family time today. You called in for a day off, after all."

"Yeah, well unexpected things happen sometimes."

I roll my eyes at that comment. I would say my transformation is something beyond 'unexpected'. He turned his eyes to me, then looked at me from top to bottom. He smiled as he patted me on the head.

"Well Tom! You're finished changing! How does it feel?" he asked.

"Rell, it freers kinda rierd, bein' arr fruffy, rand my tairl! Rit needs gerting rused to."

"Hmm...I can understand what you said, but you kinda need to practice talking again. I called Daniel to come by and give you werewolf lessons. You've been given a new, unique body, Tom. I just hope my brother can guide you in using it."

Dad ruffled my hair...Fur...Head fur before he gave mom a kiss on the cheek and headed out the door. Scott smiled as he sat beside me.

"Uncle Dan is coming? This is gonna be great, huh Tom!?"

I smiled at the thought. Uncle Daniel, or Uncle Dan as he liked to be called, was really great. He enjoyed telling stories about history with his own little twist, he always carried sweets in his pocket so he always gave us some when he comes to visit, and he loves horror movies! Okay, that last one isn't really all that great, but he always seems to pick the ones with werewolves in it. Learning that he was the werewolf of his family seemed to explain it. Anyway, Scott and I were excited with the news that he'll be coming over to visit! Well, it was to teach me on being a werewolf, but still!

"Alright Tom, I made quiche!"

Mom came in with a whole quiche in her hands. She set it down in front of me, and I couldn't help but drool at it. Mom makes the best quiche! She began cutting it up with a knife and handed Scott a slice. He began eating as she cut me a slice too. I begin eating, and it was delicious! One thing I noticed is that the flavor seems stronger for some reason. I thought about it as I munched, thinking it could be my enhanced wolf senses. Anyway, I finished off about three slices when Scott managed to finish eating his one slice. I felt a bubbling in my stomach as it traveled up my throat. As it reached my mouth, I let out a loud burp, not long, just loud. My mom looked at me expectantly as I placed a furry hand over my muzzle.

"Excruse me." I said.

My mom smiled as she took the rest of the quiche and placed it in the fridge. I rubbed my stomach as Scott watched me. I looked at him, and he just stared.

"Scrott?"

"Oh, sorry! I just thought that, if I looked away or blinked, I might wake up. But I guess I'm not really dreaming, am I? Hahahaha!"

I just laughed along with him as we both sighed and headed into the living room. Scott took the remote and turned the TV on. Typical.

"Hey Tom, maybe you should practice talking?"

I nodded as I began saying random sentences. Scott just watched TV while I tried saying tongue twisters slowly. Actually, though I did kinda understand what I was saying, it sounded a lot like gibberish when I said it. And I mean a lot.

"Thish irsh gronna take shome gettin' rushed too."

The doorbell rang. I looked at the front door, then retreated into the kitchen. Mom headed to the door and checked who it was. It was...
13211111.title: Calling Uncle Daniel

choices: Transforming into what I am now...
14.content:
My name is Sarah Summers. I'm sixteen, and an only child.

I used to have long, blond, beautiful hair. Blue eyes that all the boys would gaze into. Not anymore. Not after what happened over spring break my junior year. I remember every detail of it, as if it were yesterday...

~~~~~~~
Athens, Greece. A school-sponsored trip, and I wasn't complaining. Even though I'd taken Ancient Mythology on a whim, I never thought I'd end up here. In fact, perhaps it would have been better if I hadn't, in hindsight. Because the opportunity for destruction presented itself, and I was all too willing to accept. But that's not the point.

It was really hot, that morning. Sweat poured off me, dripping in every crevice. Everyone sweltered under the heat, except our tour guide. Born and raised on the sea. Not much older than I was, too. He was only nineteen, it wasn't a crime. A few furtive glances, and we were sharing drinks off the same water bottle. I liked to wrap my shirts then, up high to show off my waist. He always offered to help me tie my shirt up, and sometimes his hands wouldn't just make knots in the fabric. They steamed worse than the sun...

Our journey was drawing to a close. The day it happened, everyone had left for the beach. Leaving me and him behind for a "private history lesson". We hadn't hit the big monuments, after all. So in we went to a quiet little temple, currently closed for renovations. As if it mattered to us...

The first thing I remember was reaching the temple stairs. I looked straight up into the eyes of Athena, and laughed. He didn't waste time examining the statue, however, and focused his intentions instead on working his hands over a different kind of sculpture. I didn't stop him. I was naive. Who was I to imagine the consequences of youth and passion in such a sacred place? It was my first kiss, after all, sweet and sticky and amazing. I begged for more, and he obliged.

It could have been minutes, hours, days for all I cared. He sent me to Mount Olympus and back, to use a cliche. Every breath a new rush of sensation, and I couldn't help it. I gave in.

Kind of funny, then, what happened next. As he gazed deep into my eyes, my deep blue eyes, I watched his expression change from desire to repulse. His intentions turned from amorous to fearful. He pulled away, of course, and I foolishly chased after him. Little did I realize the towering statue behind me had suddenly taken to glaring at him. Her eyes darted to me, of course. I only barely recollect the moment, but my world was entirely changed. As was his.

He was lucky, my first victim. They say he recovered a month or so later. At least it was only paralysis. The next few victims weren't so fortunate as he...
14.title: Desecrations

142.content:
At least the trip was practically over. At least I could somewhat escape what I had done. Nobody traveling with me knew about it. They just figured the tour guide had called in sick. A few of the girls were disappointed, but nothing more was said on the matter. Nobody cared anymore. Some of them asked me where I'd been; with no trouble I assured them that I'd been at the beach, too. The sad truth of humanity, people will believe anything.

My superstitious roommate, however, knew the better. I'd been an idiot and gabbed about my secret rendezvous with the guide all the night before. She lost trust in me, moved out of the room before I'd even returned for the night. Better for her, then. Her paranoia actually saved her from the terror to come.

Word to the wise: If some little ordinary things seems off, it is. How I wish I'd followed that one. Coming back in from the bright day, my eyes burned something awful. So I thought it was the light... Migraine medication and a pair of cheap sunglasses later, and the pain somewhat subsided. Never mind that a chunk of my hair washed out in the shower. Never mind that I took to scratching at my face, peeling off what I assumed was sunburn. The day proved stressful enough to numb my awareness. I just wanted to sleep, be done with the day.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

It wasn't so bad. Perhaps I'm exaggerating a bit when I describe the change as terrible, horrific, even monstrous. Those first few days were uneventful after the night aforementioned. Yeah, my skin was red as a tomato, and yes, my hair was dissolving away. Of course I had to wear sunglasses all hours of day and night. But each morning, I'd wake up feeling great again, surprisingly. My hair grew back thicker, stronger, and in tight curls. They circled my head in a serpentine fashion and seemed to have a mind of their own. I could have sworn they were turning green, too. Sometimes I'd find yellowed strands of blond, and other times twinges of red. I figured it was the chlorine from the hotel's pool.

Oh, right. Did I mention I now felt a strange connection to water? I swam at least six times a day. The other girls joined me often enough, but around about midnight I started to draw looks. I never wanted to stop, either. If I wasn't sleeping or eating, I was "drowning" my troubles in the pool. The staff called me "sea-demon" out of jest, what for my sunburnt skin and discolored hair. I didn't mind the teasing, at first. I was strong from years of slander back at school. Being a pretty blonde draws a lot of attention, both positive and negative. At least I never have to deal with that label anymore.

Nobody ever roomed with me again. The teacher overlooked that fact in her nightly check-ups. To tell the truth, I think she was afraid of me, too. She had the same sort of intuition about the situation that my roommate did, and thus kept to herself around me. I hadn't a clue why, back then. I just figured it was the same as always, I was too pretty, and thus made people jealous or suspicious of my every action.

The trip ended within the week, my skin still crispy, my hair turning bizarre, unnatural shades. I wore my sunglasses, and tried to blend in with the rest of my tanned companions. None of them matched my blazing scarlet, of course. It wouldn't get any better or bearable on the home front...
142.title: A Punishing Glare

1421.content:
"What did you do to your hair? Why didn't you wear sunscreen? What's wrong with your eyes?"

Mom freaked out when she saw it all. Sean, my three-year-old brother, didn't fare much better. Within moments of stepping inside, Mom had me soaking in a tub and scrubbing off more dead skin. I almost smiled when I noticed a regular shade returning to my flesh. Somewhat regular, compared to red, a golden-brown glow. In Mom's eyes, it was just a bad tan. I couldn't explain to her why I hadn't taken off my glasses, either. Every sort of light burned them. Though this would calm down after recovery from an unfortunate head cold, I continued to wear them out of fear, inspired out of a ghastly dream. It was, of course, the recollection of my episode in the temple. The image of my victim's face frozen in my mind whenever I removed those glasses. Therefore, twenty-four hours a day, those glasses stayed on.

I didn't notice how bitter and irritable I'd become, too. I'd hiss at my mom when she asked me to do anything, and took to lashing out at Sean. Mom would blame herself, or Dad, or even demons. I saw a psychiatrist once; he didn't do a thing either. I sensed dread in him, too, the same as my former roommate and my teacher. Those looks became commonplace out in public.

And whereas I couldn't swim as much as I had in Greece, I happily adjusted to bathing three times a day. Mom would holler at me for hogging the hot water, but I scared her off with my venomous demeanor. I made enemies out of my family.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The morning I remember most, after a week of this constant anger at home, was the first day back at school. Nobody had spoken with me since the trip, and it'd be my first time back in public (discounting the psychiatrist visit). This was a day as momentous as the day I decided to fool around in a sacred temple, the second turning point.

I really started to hate life after this.
1421.title: Venom Injected

14211.content:
Everybody recalls the first day jitters. What it feels like to think, "Hey, I have to return to everyone in the town and have them stare down my every pore." The inherent vomiting that follows. It's natural, especially for a girl my age. What's not natural is waking up that same morning and not being able to look in the mirror to figure it out. What's also not natural is waking up to ruddy skin that feathers like scales, hair that screams herpetarium-meets-punk-star, and a cold, dead look. I couldn't face anyone like this. No one.

What the hell did I do to deserve this? Besides, y'know, have sex in a sacred temple. I only wanted to have some fun, and now I was suffering the torturous consequences. Most girls worry about zits, and I'm worrying about my more-than passing resemblance to the Fly!

Yet, like any girl my age who's got something to hide, I attempt to resort to my second best friend-- cosmetics. Oodles of body lotion, scrubs, foundation, moisturizer, conditioner, and even bronzer later, and I'm starting to resemble something human. I coat my face in enough blush to put "working girls" to shame. I don't even dare approach my eyes, and instead opt for some clunky sunglasses to hide the spots I can't reach. Longsleeves and pants cover the rest; it's luckily cold enough to justify the attire. On the safe side, I pick a wide fluffy scarf, thick socks and gloves to finish the look. To the passing bystander, I probably look awkward, but nowhere near otherworldly.

I just have to hope everything stays together.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I barely eat anything, I'm so nervous. The bus arrives as usual, and I'm cramped next to a portly guy. He's munching down on his breakfast, and notices I'm staring him down. I couldn't help it, the guy was more repulsive than me. So he snaps off a "What are you lookin' at?" and goes back to his food. That's the last human contact I got all day.

Nobody recognized me in my head to toe wrap-up. I was glad for that. Of course, gossip about the trip didn't escape my ears. Everybody seemed to wonder where I'd gone, and rattled off the same tale about my tragic accident. Baloney, of course.

I didn't have any trouble with classes until fourth hour. Mr. Percy, the one teacher who hated my guts, had it out for me once he called the roll.

"Summers, Susan?"

"That's me."

And I had to stand up, because he couldn't hear me, or see me. Instant ostracising.

"Care to explain why you have not taken off your winter clothes, Ms. Summers?"

"It's cold in here."

"Hats are not allowed indoors, you know school policy."

"But..."

He cocked his head to the side, a direct challenge. I could not help but comply. After all, resisting would only bring it down worse upon me.

The shock and awe of my new curls was somehting I expected. What I didn't expect is when Mr. Percy came over, snatched my hat, and apparently snagged his finger on something small and pointy. He went back with a tiny bleeding and a hurt ego.

I couldn't say I was sorry, in all honesty. It was his fault for coming near my hair. It did have a mind of its own.

But, the day wasn't over yet.
14211.title: The Morning Of...

142111.content:
Swimming. How could I have forgotten that I had swimming?

It was my fatal mistake, the one that would do me in. At this point, all I had left to do was just jump in and screw the consequences, or hide away for probably the rest of my life, giving up any hope of living.

The girls gave me awkward glances in the locker room, which I wasn't unaccustomed to getting. I didn't make friends in school, at least not with girls. I had plenty of guys willing to hang out with me, anytime. Therefore my reputation as the local whore had finally caught up to me, and I guess in a very direct way, this was punishment. Once I figured out what I was being punished with...

"Not changing, Summers?"

"No, I'm really chilly today."

"You said that in Percy's class, too."

I hated girls like her. She was the reason I didn't make friends. Let's call her Bambi. That's not really her name, but I don't think I can legally tell you the real one. Not after what happened between us. But I digress. That's a story for just a bit later.

Anyways, 'Bambi' took to bullying any girl who didn't fit her perfect little world. Her own ideal of beauty. Her notion of intelligence balanced by athleticism. She captained the swim team and student government, and managed to get more at the last homecoming than I did. That's really saying something.

So what could I do to take this girl down a few pegs?

I could show her a taste of my latest asset. I could take that plunge.

Or I could just sit here and laugh privately at her stupidity.
142111.title: Swim Class

1421111.content:
"What's wrong, Summers? Problem with your complexion today? That would explain the ugly sweater."

The sweater comment grasped at straws. Really? What about this girl had intimidated me? Now I just wanted to hear what she'd say when she saw the really ugly part of me.

"Get out of my way."

"What? Going so soon?"

"I need to shower first."

The girls spun on me. Nobody had expected me to even sit in the locker room, let alone shower. And that's just where I wanted them, the jerks. What did I care about their thoughts? The best insults they could throw at me involved ugly sweaters. So now, I was going to let my hair down and my skin out as natural. Even if I was cursed, I could relish what the effects were on those around me.

That was some pretty delusional thinking, now that I mention it.

In I went, to the claustrophobic little shower stall. I stripped myself of the layers and let the water pour out over me. While the makeup melted off my skin, the happy hydration replenished the reptilian texture to something even smooth. I freed my hair and it hissed in delight. The sensation pouring over me was almost too much to bear. I needed water, that was all. The natural quality of my skin came out from mere liquid. From the mildly reflective stall door, I thought myself beautiful, possibly. Without a doubt, I was ready for the pool.

I made sure to put my glasses back on, of course. I didn't want any accidental comas until we hit poolside. After all, it's much more fun when you can blame it on the sport.
1421111.title: Show 'Er Up

14211111.content:
Those days spent in the waters of Greece flooded my mind as I stepped up to the ledge. I couldn't wait to jump back in and swim again. The water tickled the tips of my toes, and sloshed around my ankles in anticipation. Bambi gave me a once-over as I indulged the moment. I held back a laugh.

"Ready, set, go!!"

We plunged head first into the crystal clear pool, bolting through the water like a knife through butter. But Bambi couldn't keep up with my inhuman pace, and fell behind even before the turnabout. I lost no time to thought of Bambi. I had to keep going, to keep swimming. It was the only way I could avert my eyes from the light. How good it felt to just swim again. If I hadn't known better, I might have imagined myself some sort of mermaid.

That would have been very wrong indeed.

Needless to say, the race ended in my favor. Bambi had been obliterated by my new record. I could imagine her turning down her position as team captain later in the afternoon. Out of courtesy only did she come up to shake my hand. It was then my nasty side got the better of me.

"Great job, Scaly."

Offended beyond belief, I shot her a threatening glare. It was the last glare I remember giving her, too. The last glance anyone would give her.

She tensed up immediately, turned cold in my hand. I recoiled out of fear, and ducked out for the lockers. I didn't want to watch what would happen next. I knew too well. It was the same as the boy in Greece. Only this time...

I was a killer.
14211111.title: The Sea-Demon

142111112.content:
Only later, when I met others like me (you might call them monsters) did I find out that killing innocent humans is a catalyst to transformations. If you started out human, got cursed or bit or whatever, then killed somebody? You were lucky if even a trace amount of humanity still existed in you. For me, the shift, as the others call it, hit hard. I could physically experience the loss of my humanity; it dripped like rain.

All those other twits who witnessed Bambi's sudden seizure and paralysis stood agape. None of them believed what they saw, nor would they believe it was me. Not for long, of course, as I transitioned into the shift. I knew it from the moment I "killed" Bambi.

I caught my nails stretching into claws. My legs lumbered me into the water, just in time to fuse into that perfect tail for swimming. My generally attractive features pitched to a higher degree, with the whole of my figure developing fin-like peaks and valleys. I went from average to exotic to bizarre in about five minutes. Any traces of that beautiful spring tan finally shook away to reveal my new metallic scales. The light in my eyes filtered in with a jaundiced tint, my pupils thinning out to distort my perspective in a convex fashion. The jagged edges of my discolored hair revived from dead skin cells to an active patch of live snakes. They corkscrewed around my neck on the water's surface.

From then on, I wouldn't be just Sarah Summers, the popular junior. I wasn't even just a human.

I was a monster.

And to tell the truth, I relished the feeling. Everyone around me was weak and useless; I was strong and unstoppable. None of them could even look me in the eyes. So of course I did what any rational teenage girl suddenly put in a position of power would-- I abused the hell out of it.
142111112.title: Nature of the Beast

1421111121.content:
They tried to run away, the smart ones. Others froze in place without my help. I didn't bother with the zombified ones, I only wanted to ensnare my moving targets. More fun, in a twisted way. None of them could help looking back, and I shot them glances like daggers, pinning them to the spot. First it was Bambi's best friend, then some other girl, and another, until the entire swim class was locked in position.

Only then did I realize my juvenile mistake. I forgot about the swim teacher. And that teacher had, by this point, called the cops and anyone who would answer.

Worst of all, I had no legs to speak of, so I was trapped in the pool until they arrived. I wanted to lash out at the teacher, but I couldn't even mount the steps out. Utterly helpless, I played the waiting game. I waited, and waited, and waited, and waited...

The final bell for the school day rang, and nobody had showed up yet. Everything felt utterly pointless, and the girls were still frozen to their spots. What fun is it to mess with stone-faced girls? Not much, not much at all.

Tired of this tedium, I started to scream shrilly. Only then did my potential captors show themselves.
1421111121.title: Tomfoolery

14211111212.content:
They didn't come out brash and bold. In fact, they snuck right up on me, despite all my newfound abilities. One grappled me like an alligator while others, wearing full-face shields that diverted my gaze, wrapped me in rope. I writhed in my confinement as all without, but they wouldn't budge a bit. Seems my transformation had finally wrought the proper attention, but from who I did not know. I wouldn't know much after that point, as one of the kindly captors knocked me out with a mysteriously potent gas.

I awoke in the room I now sit in, staring into an endless abyss of black. Light filtered from a diluted prism on the ceiling, but none of the other windows nor the peephole in the door offered me any view. For the safety of my observers, I suppose. My tail was submerged in a snugly fitting (and locked) chamber of water, barely keeping it hydrated.

At the moment, I was preoccupied with wailing and scratching at my darkened cell, too preoccupied to notice the cameras pointed at me. Considering they tinted the sunlight a dark, bloody red, I should have caught on sooner. But then, how can I be expected to expect being watched?

I wouldn't be screaming for long. Someone finally turned on the lights. Now I could see the white-washed tint of my four walls, and the faint outline of the observation deck. From overhead, within the camera's range, a speaker rung out with a voice now very familiar to me.

"Sarah Summers, age 16, student at Genesis High School? Or shall I say, former student?"

I wasn't in my right mind. Forgive me. I'll censor my response for the records, but let's just say it wasn't very polite, okay?

"Sarah, you have been charged with conspiracy to murder, manslaughter, and sexual misconduct. Will you comply with these charges and accept the punishment?"

I didn't mean to do anything, I made that clear to them. But that meant nothing considering the fate of the swim team, my Grecian lover, and several others that I probably forgot. I cried for my sins, but I couldn't read any sympathy from my captors.

"Will you accept the charges, Sarah Summers?"

I couldn't fight the voice. I might never see the true light of day again. So, I nodded. I'm glad I did.

"Good, then we may begin. Draco, relinquish the restraints."

How glad I was to be rid of my chains. So glad I immediately charged for the window. I neglected to remember my tail, however.

"It will take a long time for you, Sarah Summers. A very long time..."
14211111212.title: Caged Beast

142111112121.content:
Out cold. Again. Until I hit the crystal clear waters of a pool. I awoke in shivers to find myself... free. I didn't know exactly what to do. Above me, on a platform eight feet or so in the air, stood two masked figures, obscured from my gaze. They watched me swim for a while, but I wouldn't be observed for long.

I asked: "Do you want to explain what's going on here? Where am I? Who are you people? Why am I being punished?"

"Welcome, Sarah Summers. This will be your... rehabilitation hall. You are being punished for the charges you accepted, and as such will take part in the Redemption Project."

That didn't answer my other question. Who in the world were these people, I thought? I knew what they wanted from me, but who were 'they'?

I learned I would have an hour a day to swim. Only one hour. The worst was yet to come, when that hour was spent...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I didn't know how I was supposed to get out of the water. I couldn't walk without legs, and the molded tail eliminated any hope of that, or so I thought...

A masked doctor accompanied my regular guards at the pool's edge. I scoffed at him. He showed the same distaste for me. He also had a bag full of needles.

'Free heroin injections?' I wondered. He didn't have the same sense of humor.

"Your arm, Ms. Summers."

I refused. I didn't want him sticking anything like that in my arm. Especially when I didn't know what the consequences would be!

"If you would give me your arm, Ms. Summers, we do not have all day. This injection will become routine to you, soon enough. Make haste, we will have you out of this pool."

Only then did it occur to me. Just as he stuck the fat needle in the crook of my arm. The ruddy liquid burned in my veins, boiling my cold blood. The flow traveled the length of my body, trickling to the tips of my fingers, the lines of my belly, and finally the curves of my thighs. I hadn't even begun to know pain before that moment when it hit the tip of my tail. I cried in agony, and the doctor merely stiffened my arm out and the two guards held me in place. The vigorous and excruciating second transformation began, and I was helpless to stop it.

I wanted to pass out badly, just as I had in the pool at school and my own private cell. But, nature would not allow it; I had to suffer through the split of my tail into two tenderly human legs. The rest of me followed suit, peeling away scales to show regular old skin, and my hair even growing an inch of honest blond again. The hissing curls died down into flat, empty hair. But I knew this was all a facade. I wasn't any more human than I had been a second ago, but this needle full of I don't know what masked my true form in the transfiguration of my former self. And why did I know? The guards still refused to look me in the eyes.

I was escorted into the Briefing room, where I would "meet" my sponsor. I use the term sponsor in place of the long and complicated Greek term I was offered. Both name the same position: my new babysitter.

She was a kindly looking woman, apart from the eyes. I could have buried myself in those black pits of nothingness. She wasn't susceptible to my unfortunate talents, which is exactly why we made such a pair. I'm glad to have met her now, in retrospect. I thank her every day for my early lessons, before I was wise enough to understand what I had become. She offered me all the answers she could.

"Welcome, Sarah Summers. I am to be your new guardian. You may call me Lucia, if you like. I will assist you in the Redemption process, if you are willing to cooperate. Oh, and please take a seat, if you haven't already. I know my appearance can be quite shocking, or so I'm told. But then again, you're no stranger to bizarre looks, are you?"

Her laughter felt out of place. I didn't want to join in.

"Well, let us begin, then? What questions do you have for me?"

I asked her cautiously, "What is this whole deal? Why am I being punished? What's happened to me?"

"I will answer to the best of my abilities, but you may not care for my responses. You, Sarah Summers, are the victim of a cruel fate. For your sinful indulgence in the Temple, the Goddess has chosen to have you cursed with your current state. You are undoubtedly aware by now that you have begun the arduous transformation into a Gorgon, have you not?"

A Gorgon? I barely knew what one was at the time.

"I'm sorry, I forget that children may not be as familiar with the old myths. A Gorgon, my dear, is a sea demon, particularly known for her gaze that turns people to stone."

Something troubled me about her statements; "I've just begun the transformation, you say? But I have a tail, and scales. Snakes in my hair, even!"

"Oh, you poor, poor darling. You have it so easy right now. It will get worse, I'm sorry to say. At least you aren't as unlucky as the others who've insulted the Goddess. Some of them don't get the honor of Redemption. I assume your age has much to do with it."

"So I'm a Gorgon, and I'm in for a world of pain. But tell me this, who in the world are you people? Who is this Goddess?"

"My dear girl... We are the agents of the Gods themselves, and the Goddess whom I serve is the one you call Athena. And despite your crimes against her, she has chosen you to become one of her agents as well."

But I didn't want that, not at first. I didn't want anything to do with the 'Goddess' who'd turned me into a monster. I wanted out of it, and I didn't care whether that was human or Gorgon.

"I don't want to be her agent."

"In time you will, my dear Sarah, in time you will. We will commence our next interview within the week, I'm afraid I must attend to the other internees at the moment. Good day, Sarah Summers. Behave yourself, and all may be well."

The cryptic responses I received from Lucia didn't put my mind at ease, not at all.
142111112121.title: The Pantheon

14212.content:
At school, I still wore the dark sunglasses, in fear of what my stare might do. I avoided questions regarding them and eventually found myself being sent to the principals office as I refused to remove them in class or explain why I was wearing them indoors. "Who would believe me?" I said to myself.

"Sarah, Summers." said the secretary, looking up from her desk. "The principal is ready for you."

I sighed then walked into the office, closing the door behind me to face the principal, Max Stone. The students who had crossed his path had said he had a heart of stone with no leniency when it came to the rules. "Mr. Stone..." I said.

"You can relax, Sarah." said Max, calmly. "I know why you are wearing shades and why you can't tell anyone." he sighed, turning around, then shocked me by turning into stone! I opened my mouth to scream but I was surprised again when he walked around his desk. "You can take your shades off now, young lady. You can't effect what is already stone."

Slowly, and in shock, I removed my sunglasses and watched as a smile formed onto Max's face. "I am what one may call a gargoyle, or a living statue." he said. "You are slowly becoming a being similar to Medusa in Greek mythology." he paused, sighing. "You're not the only person fell to temptation in the ancient temples."

"Is there any way to change myself back?" I asked.

Max gave me a sad look. "I've been trying to answer that question for twenty years now." he replied, to my tears. "I can help you deal with this, though."

"How?" I asked, tears falling."

Max handed me a pair of glasses. "These are joke glasses, they'll give you a mirrored look at the world around you." he explained. "It will do the same for those who look into your eyes, a Medusa's reflection can not harm anyone."

I took the glasses and put them on as Max them returned to his normal flesh state. I looked at him and was surprised that he was still moving about. "Thank you, Mr. Stone." I said, starting to cry. "I promise I won't tell anyone about you."

Max smiled. "Who would believe you anyway?" he asked. then he turned serious. "Your changes are only starting, I suggest a vacation until they are done. I'll try to help you from there."

As I left the principals office, I held a new sense of confidence but wondered what to do...

151.content:

Age: 14 years old

That's pretty much me in a nutshell. Living in Los Angeles with my family and going to Middle School with my friends. I've got a brother and 2 sisters. The brother is Andy who is 9 year old. 151.title: Character 1

1511.content:
Suddenly, I felt kind of odd as a wierd feeling started to overwhelm me. It wasn't painful, yet it wasn't pleasant either. It was kind of inbetween if that makes any sense.

"Ugh, what's up with me?" I asked myself as I bent down, trying to catch my breath. It was almost like I couldn't breathe for a while. It was like my whole body was acting all messed up today.

Maybe the lack of breath was because I was suddenly feeling weaker, as if my muscles and build were beginning to shrink and lose energy or something. As I bent down on the ground, it was almost as if the room was slightly getting bigger or something. However, that couldn't be real right? People don't just shrink like that.

Soon enough, I was able to breathe lightly again. With that, I stood up and looked around. Nothing seemed too out of the ordinary, although I did still feel a little small.

"Maybe I'm just losing it" I concluded as I did still have a little headache to go with this. What a fun way to start the say huh?

Suddenly, Emma entered my room again.

"Hey James, can you come to my room for a sec?" she asked politely. I figured that I might as well. I was a little curious as to what has her so excited.

"Sure I guess" I replied, which made her smile. With that, she grabbed my hand and walked me to her room. I just went along with it even though I felt wierd with her dragging me like that.

Soon enough, we reached her room and we both went inside. Emma's room was pretty standard for a girl her age which I guess is explanation enough.

Then, she went to her dresser and got something off of the top of it. It was....
1511.title: Subtle Change

15111.content:
"Um, what is that, Emma?" I asked her.

"This? This is something I found in the backyard. It's pretty isn't it?" asked Emma. I looked at it. It was a necklace with some kind of dragon symbol on it. It was kind of cool...yet a little creepy too.

"Um, sure. It's cool" I said, trying to make her feel good about it. It worked as she smiled.

"Really? Do you want it? I don't need it" said Emma.

"Are you sure" I asked.

"Yep, here take it! It'll look good on you, I'm sure" said Emma. I took her word for it, looping the nacklace around my neck. It was kind of cool as I stated earlier but I was feeling anxious for some reason.

Suddenly, I felt as if the thing got hot on my skin, as if it was trying to burn into it. I cringed slightly, not trying to alarm Emma.

"James, are you ok?" asked Emma. She noticed after all.

"Um, yes. I'm fine" said I, after it lessoned a bit. It was so wierd. It was like the necklace almost became fire. I looked down and sawn nothing on my chest. Maybe I was just imagining it?"

"Well, let's go downstairs" said Emma and she skipped down the stairs to the kitchen.

"Why do I feel as if nothing will be the same from here on?" I wondered to myself as I followed her.

It was true after all. I just couldn't imagine how.
15111.title: A bronze dragon necklace

choices: a necklace with a centaur arrow
She takes me to her room
1512.content:
"Ugh" I said as a sudden cramping seemed to claim my stomach. It wasn't painful thankfully, but it was quite discomforting and made me buckle over and fall to the ground, causing a loud noise as I did.

"James, are you ok?!!" yelled a high-pitched voice. I imagine that it was Emma, my sister.

"I'm fine!" I gritted through my clenched teeth. I was still down on the ground, gripping my aching stomach. In a way, it was almost as if it was trying to become more compact in size. My stomach I mean. It was like it was trying to shrink, and other organs and bones around it were trying to shrink as well. I didn't really get it.

After about 5 minutes or so, the discomfort finally vanished. "Finally" I said, exasperated. I was able to stand up and get my bearings. After pulling up my shirt, I took a look to see if my waist was still the same. Well, I found out that it wasn't. It seemed to be considerably thinner than usual and the stomach area seemed to be much flatter. It was almost like one of those flat stomachs you see female models with and such.

"That's crazy right?" I asked myself. Maybe I was just hallucinating or something. I didn't know. It wasn't like there was some kind of magic that changed me. There's no such thing as magic. At least, I had no reason to believe that it did exist. I had seen no evidence of it. Then again, the fact of the matter was that I was considerably thinner now. What should I make of that?

However, right at that moment, Emma decided to barge into my room with something in hand.
1512.title: Stomach Ache

15121.content:
Suddenly, Emma comes into my room. In her hands, she was holding a necklace. It seemed to be quite ordinary, except for the arrow that was in front.

"Hello brother!" said Emma, giving me her bright smile. I ended up smiling as well. Emma and I genuinely got along much better than most brothers and sisters. That was a pretty good thing we had going on.

"Hello Emma, what is it?" I asked. Emma then handed me the necklace that she brought with her. "Please try it on." she told me.

"Why?" was my simple reply.

"I want to see how it looks on you" she responded.

I sighed to that, Emma was very hard to argue with sometimes. Reluctantly, I hooked the necklace on around my neck. As the cold metal touched my skin, it was as if a shock wave had gone through my skin. It was so weird.

"Well?" asked Emma, her eyes dancing.

"It's nice" I replied, if only to please her. Emma giggled and jumped up and down. "Great, can you come with me then to my room?" she asked me.

I slowly nodded and she grabbed my hand, pulling me along. I really needed to learn how to control her at times. It wasn't too long before she pulled me into her room and ran towards the window. I looked out there and saw the centaur statue that we had in our backyard.

You see, we owned a ranch someways from here. Our family had a bit of a belief in the Roman legends. With that in mind, we had the centaur statue put there for good luck. Emma especially liked it. She loved horses and our ranch and I loved watching her be happy. However, she now had a somewhat sad look on her face.

"The bad people are planning to take our ranch away. They say that we don't have enough money" said Emma.

I had never heard of that although it made sense. We didn't have the necessary funds to keep it going right now. It was in dire straits. It was time for that statue to work its magic as they say. Although, nothing had happened yet. However, Emma seemed to brighten up somewhat.

"Everything is going to be okay, big brother." she said.

I grinned, trying to ignore the slight pain in my stomach still lingering from earlier. "Oh? How so?"

"I asked the centaur girl to send us help." said Emma. "She smiled at me."

"She... smiled at you?" I asked, slowly.

"When a centaur girl smiles, she can help." said Emma. "That is when I found the necklace." she beamed as she then added, "It hanging on your bedroom door."

"Well, I hope your wish comes true." you said, honestly. "I really do, Emma."

With that, you walked away, scratching your chest. "Man, what is wrong with me today?"
