I sported an awesome set of abs below my pecs and my arms were incredibly thick. I was now every bodybuilder’s dream! The only thing… I was lime green and I had green hair and I had bright, green eyes! I had grown almost a foot taller and my hands, my feet, my fingers, my toes, and just about everything else about me had gotten twice as big as before! I was way over 6 feet tall… Make that almost 7 feet tall, and I was bursting with muscle and I was completely lime green, from head to toe!

“Okay… Okay… Calm down, Rex…” I panted in my deep, baritone voice… I couldn’t believe how I sounded now. It even sounded kinda sexy. I was so huge. I hate to admit it, but I was actually started to like this “Hulking Out”. Yes, I had become a big, green monster. But, MAN, I was STRONG! I had muscles everywhere!

I was so HUGE, I almost couldn’t fit in my bathroom! My shoulders were super wide and my torso was enormous! My arms were super-thick and they were covered with muscle all over! My hands were enormous, they were like shovels! Not to mention my gigantic feet and my titanic calves which were bigger than basketballs. I was the most muscular dude ever!

“Okay… Now… I need to become normal again…” I said calmly.

I took a deep breath and I closed my eyes. I told myself to relax. Relax. I let my enormous arms just hand off the side of my hulking body. Gosh, it almost seemed impossible to relax with all this muscle. But, I had to learn this. I had to CONTROL this… BEAST that was ME. I was in control! I didn’t want this Hulking-thing to control me… NO! I had to be in control of my muscles and my body. I’m in charge. My muscles don’t control me. I control THEM!

So, I willed them to shrink back and for my skin to fade back to normal.

Slowly but surely, I felt my muscles dwindle back to normal. I was becoming smaller, or normal again. Within moments, the green color faded away and I had shrunk back. As I opened my eyes, my reflection was the old Rex again. I was covered with sweat, but I was happy. I had mastered the Hulk in me.

Since I was home anyway, I decided to pick up the phone. I called grandma. I tried her again. She was home this time. I got dressed and I hopped on my bike. About twenty minutes later, I was at her house.

“Grandma… I learned something…” I told her, as I sat down on the couch facing her, as she sat in her rocking chair. “I can control it! I can make it grow my muscles, and I can make it shrink back!”

“That’s very good dear!” she smiled. “Take your time and learn how to use your strength. Don’t be afraid of it. You’re doing something I wish your grandfather had done…”

Now that she mentioned grandpa, so many more questions suddenly entered my mind…
1521122111111.title: Confronting grandma.

choices: The story of Bruce and the Hulk.
15211221111111.content:
"Please tell me about grandpa." you begged. "I want to know more about who and what I am becoming."

Grandma smiled. "You are becoming a fine young man with a power and a curse." she replied. "However, every curse can become a blessing."

"What do you mean?" you asked, curious. "How is hulking out a curse?"

"Can you imagine what certain selfish people could do if they could control you with that power, young man?" asked grandma. "Our military tried to control your grandfather but failed miserably, causing millions of dollars in damages and a number of uncomfortable questions from other nations and interest groups." she sighed, thinking back. "Bruce is a good man, Rex, you may meet him someday... if you are discovered."

"Meaning, I would have to go into hiding as well." you said, downcast.

"Your father was forced to do the same, Rex." said grandma, calmly. "Last I heard, he was in Europe, somewhere." she shrugged. "All the males in this family have that power, Rex. I'm not sure if a girl would gain that power or not.. guess we'll find out if you have a daughter down the line."

You blushed at that as grandma giggled. "The point is, Rex, you need not fear your power, just those who would try to control you."

"How did grandpa get his powers?" you asked.

"That is a long story, Rex." replied grandma. "Let's just say he was a scientist who's father tried to play God and lost."
15211221111111.title: Talking to grandma about grandpa

152112211111112.content:
"It's a rather long and complicated story, Rex." said grandma (Betty), with a sigh. "Your grandfather will tell you the entire story when you meet him later on." she smiled. "What is important right now is that I need your help, Rex."

"My help?" asked Rex, surprised. "Is there something wrong?"

Betty giggled. "Do you remember your aunt Caroline Runner?" she asked. "Well, she too married a 'monster', I guess it runs in our blood." she shrugged. "Anyway, you have a cousin named Sky Runner. She's ten years old and she too is developing a power, one that scares her greatly."

"Strength?" you asked.

Betty shook her head. "Super speed." she replied. "Your aunt once clocked her at a hundred and fifty miles per hour." she giggled at your wide eyed response and added, "Poor sky gets picked on at school because she must scuff her feet to keep herself from moving at high speeds. I'm hoping you can give her some support by showing her she is not alone in the super powers department."

"I guess I could do that.' you said, wondering if this was a distraction. "What about school?"

"You just said you can control your powers, right?" asked Betty. "You'll be fine as long as you don't hulk out in the middle of class."

You laughed at that. "I guess you're right, grandma." you said, smiling. "Where is Sky?"

"Um... over here." said a tiny voice.

You turned around to find a slender girl, nervously sitting in a chair. She was rather short, no taller than five feet, with mid back length blond hair, and blue eyes. She was very slender for her age with doll like features that, in all, made her very attractive but her pose was that of a very self conscious person. "Hey, cousin." you said, gently. "You heard about what I can do, right?"

Sky nodded, looking frightened. "I heard." she said timidly. "I can't compete with that, I'm afraid."

You shook your head, grinning. "Ever heard of The flash?" you asked.

Sky gave you a confused look. "Who's that?"

Betty giggled. "I can see you two have much to talk about." she said. "I think I will go take a nap." she paused. "Rex, can you watch over sky for a few hours?"

You smiled. "Sure, grandma."
152112211111112.title: Grandma changes the subject.

1522.content:
Maybe it was just because I was still groggy, but I decided that things would just work themselves out, and went to take a shower. I figured the shower would have to help with that weird rash, right?

Well, I might have been half-asleep when I went in the shower, but I woke up quickly as I lathered myself up. As I washed, I felt something unusual in the neighborhood of my butt. Needless to say, there hadn't been anything different back there before. You know, you've seen one, you've seen them all. Except that couln't be said about me anymore.

Once I rinsed off, I went to the mirror to check myself out, and did I get a shock. I had grown a little tail. And it was as green as that spot on my arm.
1522.title: I shrugged it off, took a shower.

153.content:
Name: Nancy Duquesne

Age: Just turned 14

Description: Platinum blonde hair, ice blue eyes

Personality: Outgoing




I guess you could say things are okay for my family. We inherited a lot of money when my grandparents on Mom's side died in a car accident, and we moved into their house. It's a pretty big house, with a large barn in back. No animals, though, which kind of made me wonder why it was built in the first place.

I guess things started to get weird for me the morning after my first period. I mean, the occasion itself was standard, with Dad congratulating me and Mom giving me The Talk. The next morning, though, was completely different from what I expected.

It started when I woke up. It felt like I'd been wrapped in a straitjacket. I couldn't imagine what had happened. Finally, I took a deep breath, and something ripped. After that, I felt a little better. That's when I examined myself. The thing that was too tight on me was my nightgown. It had fit me fine the night before, but now it looked like it was made for someone smaller.

I heard Mom doing something outside my room. We preferred to do things ourselves, even though we could afford servants. "Mom," I called, "can you take a look at this?"

It didn't take long for Mom to knock on my door. "Did you say something, Nancy?"

"Yeah," I replied. "Hang on." I crossed the room and opened the door, and this is where I got another shock.

Mom was 5'7". The night before, I had been 5'4". That morning, though, I could look Mom square in the eye.
153.title: Nancy Duquesne

1533.content:
I could tell Mom was as shocked as I was, but it seemed... different for her. And not just because she wasn't the one going through this. "I think we'd better sit down, Nancy."

"What is happening?" I asked as we sat on my bed. "How'd I grow so much in just one night?"

"You're taking after my mother."

"I don't think so, Mom. I remember Grandma Archer, and she wasn't this tall."

Mom shook her head. "Honey Archer was my stepmother. My birth mother was Nancy Archer."

"Wait a minute," I said. "Birth mother? How come I never heard about this?"

"It's best if you let me explain it," Mom replied. "You see, before I was born, my parents were young and in love. It seemed like nothing could keep them apart. Then came the event that changed everything."

She pointed out by Three Mile Point. "As I heard it, Mom and Dad were having a picnic out there, when it happened."

"What happened?"

"A meteorite. It crashed close by, and sent a fragment into my mother. The doctor patched her up, and said he wanted her to come in, if anything happened.

"It didn't take long. You see, Nancy, she started growing. A few inches at a time, at first. Once she got big enough, the growth started coming in feet. She didn't stop growing until she was 50 feet tall. Then came the big shock."

"What big shock?"

"She was pregnant. At first, she worried that the baby would be as big as she was. When that turned out not to be the case, she was positively terrified, worried that she couldn't bond with her child, or that she might accidentally crush it.

"Well, I was born to her in due time. I've been told that my birth was quite memorable for the doctor, as well."

"So," I asked, "what happened to Grandma Nancy?"

Mom shook her head. "She commited suicide, not long after I was born. She went out one night and pulled apart a transformer. We never knew exactly why. To make it all worse, some movie studio made a film out of it, changing everything but the names. Dad tried to sue, but the pinheaded judge figured that the different details made it a completely different story."

"Oh, Mom, I'm so sorry." I hugged her. Pretty easy, considering we were the same size.

Something occurred to me, and I pulled away. "Wait a minute. If Grandma was 50 feet tall,... "

Mom nodded. "I'm afraid your growth is just starting, Nancy."
1533.title: Mom knows what's going on

15331.content:
I looked back at my closet. "I'm afraid none of my clothes will fit, as is. Once I get bigger,... "

Mom nodded. "We'll get you something from my closet, at least until I can take you shopping."

"Crap!" I said. "I just remembered, my friends are coming over to go swimming!"

Mom shrugged. "You'll just have to borrow my swimsuit."

"Mom," I replied, "leaving aside the fashion disaster that is your swimsuit, I'm more worried about what happens when my friends see me. They know me as a short little thing. How'm I supposed to explain this?"

"You'll have to explain it, Nancy. As I told you, you're going to be growing for some time. This isn't something that you can keep secret."

With no recourse, I glumly followed Mom to her room and put on her swimsuit.
15331.title: Friends come to visit

153311.content:
My two best friends, Joyce Parks and Gina Weaver were the first to arrive. They were near my age but a few inches taller. In fact, on average, all of the students my age were a little taller. Fortunately, most of my classmates were cool about it. Both Joyce and Gina were greeted by mom. "Nancy will be out in a minute." Kindly, she said. "She's going through a few changes right now."

Joyce sighed. "Her time of the month, huh... she should still be able to swim."

Gina winced. "Is she feeling shy about it?"

"Nancy did have her first period yesterday but that's not the kind of change I was referring to." Softly, mom said. "She had a growth spurt."

At that moment, I walked out, wearing mom's one piece floral swimsuit, blushing. "It's a little tight, mom." Frowning, I said. "We'll need to go shopping soon."

Joyce and Gina looked at me in shock. "Now that's a growth spurt!" In awe, Gina said.

I sighed and turned to mom only to find out why her swimsuit was too tight. I was now able to look over her head! "Oy vey...!"
153311.title: The gang's all here

1533111.content:
"Nancy," Joyce asked, "what the hell happened to you?"

Gina swallowed, unnerved by having to look up at me. "You're, like, a foot taller."

"More like six inches," Mom said. "I'm glad that swimsuit has so much give."

I sighed, sitting on the side of the pool. "Mom says my real grandmother was huge," I explained. "Now it's happening to me. I was Mom's size when I got up this morning. I've grown again since."

"Excuse me," Joyce said. "But, exactly how big is huge?"

"50 feet tall."

"Hoo boy."

"You'll be able to stay in the house for a while," Mom said. "After that,... well, that's what the barn was for."

"Grandma slept in a barn?"

"Try to stay calm, Nancy. Letting yourself get agitated might cause another growth spurt."

I certainly didn't want that. I took a deep breath, then let it out slowly. "I was going to suggest we go shopping," I said, "but, at the rate I'm growing, I'll be too big for whatever we bought by the time we got home. So, what do we do?"

"We'll need to get creative," Mom said. "Turn bedsheets into dresses, for as long as we can." Turning to my girlfriends, she asked, "Can you girls help me?"

Joyce and Gina agreed, and the four of us went inside.
1533111.title: Explanations.

15331111.content:
"The first thing we need to do is see what materials we have to work with." Serious, Gina said. "The softest sheets should go making undergarments."

"I have a few lovely silk sheets." Grinning, mom said.

"I don't want to know..." Wincing, I said.

Mom opened a closet and pulled out various sheets and blankets. Gina and Joyce looked them over. "This is going to be fun." Grabbing a sheet, Gina said. "It reminds me of that musical where a nanny made clothes out of curtains."

Joyce giggled. "I remember that musical." Smiling, she said. Then she sang, "How do you solve a problem like... Nancy."

"Very funny..." Cracking a grin, I said.

With that, we all began making clothes out of the sheets and blankets. Mom ordered pizza and soda for lunch and provided gloves to eat it with so not to stain the fabric. Although it took all day and into the evening, we had a great time. All in all, I gained ten outfits and a number of undergarments from mom's silk sheets.

"Time for a fashion show!" Giggling, Joyce said. "Let's see how our new linen line looks on you, Nancy!"

I laughed at that. "Linen line... that's funny!"

Mom set up a little runway and I walked out into the sitting room wearing a comfortable dress made of white sheets. Mom had added some frills from a large table cloth, making the dress look surprisingly amazing. I blushed as Gina and Joyce cheered and whistled at their creations.

"You look stunning, honey." Smiling, mom cooed. "It's a good thing we made these clothes a little big for you as I'm certain more growth spurts will come."

"Actually I'm impressed how comfortable they are, especially the undergarments." softly, I said. I turned to my friends. "Thanks, guys, I couldn't have done this so fast without you and mom."

The next outfit was a blue blanket skirt with a white sheet blouse. The skirt went down to my knees and had a button fly on the side. The shirt had the same tablecloth frills on the collar and sleeves. Incredibly, they all looked store bought. "People are going to ask me where we got these." Smiling slightly, I muttered.

"I don't think that will be their first question, dear." Grinning, mom said. "You've grown another few inches."

I looked down and sighed. "I did..."

"Don't worry." Calmly, mom said. "We made these clothes with that in mind."

"I'm going to be fifty feet in no time at this rate." Pouting, I said.

"Well, according to my mother's diary, she grew a few feet a few inches at a time before it seemed to stop." Softly, mom said. "then the real growth spurts began with some catalyst."

"What catalyst?" Curious, Gina asked.

Mom shrugged. "I'm not sure." Honestly, she replied. "I don't think my mother ever figured it out."

I sighed. "Lovely..."
15331111.title: Desperate Fashions

153311111.content:
"Do I have to go to school?" I asked.

"You're a perfectly healthy young woman," Mom replied. "Give me one good reason why you shouldn't go to school."

"Besides," Dad added, "you used to love school."

"I can give you seven reasons," I told Mom. "That's how tall I'll be come my next growth spurt. I'm already taller than the boys' basketball team, and all of the teachers."

"You'll be fine," Dad said as he got up from the breakfast table. He tried to kiss my forehead, like he always did, but he wound up headbutting me instead.

"Maybe I will," I said, "once I recover." I shook my head.

"I know this is going to be hard, honey," Mom said, "but I want you to have as normal a life as you can, and that means going to school until they say you can't go anymore." She packed my lunch in a grocery bag, then handed me a huge Thermos. "Let's see how this goes, okay? Besides, you'll get to show off your dresses for at least a while."

The stares I got walking to the bus stop were eclipsed by the stares I got as I climbed onboard the school bus, and they were eclipsed by the stares I got when I arrived at school.
153311111.title: Back to school.

1533111111.content:
Before this had happened, I was barely noticed but now I was getting more attention than I was comfortable with. Standing at six foot, I towered over all of the students and most of the teachers. Fortunately, I got mostly kind comments from my peers including where I found my new clothing. "It's the Linen line." Giggling, I explained. "My friends and I put them together because I'm likely to grow even more."

"I guess it skips a generation here and there." Startling me, a man said.

I turned to find Mr. Moore, the history teacher. He was the oldest teacher in school, only a few months away from retirement. "You know about this?" Curious, I asked.

"Indeed I do." Smiling, Mr Moore said. "Your grandmother was quite the celebrity here in town though she feared for everyone's safety."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, I asked.

Mr Moore sighed. "You need to understand that the world your grandmother lived in was completely different to today." Softly, he explained. "When word spread of her giantess status, a lot of power hungry people, including some from the government wanted to take advantage of her." He sadly shook his head. "With nowhere to hide, she decided to take her own life rather than put the community she loved at risk."

"No one helped her..." Wincing, I asked.

"We tried to help her." Sadly, Mr Moore said. "Only how do you give a depressed fifty foot woman a hug and tell her everything is going to be alright..."

I sighed. "That doesn't exactly fill me with confidence."

"It's a different world today." Smiling, Mr Moore said. "We still have inequality, hatred, and discrimination only less people are willing to tolerate it."

That made me smile. "Thank you, Mr Moore."

I was about to hurry on to my first class only a sudden pain in my body caused me to yelp and buckle over. Instantly after, I grew right in front of the students and teachers. As I slowly stood up, I found that I now towered over everyone. Mr Moore took out his cellphone and asked to stand straight and still.

"You- You want to take my picture?" Blushing, I asked.

"I have a measure app which will allow me to measure your height." Calmly, Mr. Moore replied. "Let us see how much you grew this time."

I stood as still as I could as Mr. Moore pointed his cellphone at my feet then moved it up to my head. "Impressive..." Smiling, he said.

"How tall am I now?" Wincing, I asked.

"Seven foot." Smiling, Mr. Moore said. "You are growing just as your grandmother did."

Then the bell rang and I hurried to my first class...
1533111111.title: A growing history.

15331111111.content:
Once I got to the gym, I realized that there was an oversight in creating the Linen line: I didn't have anything my size for P.E. The uniform that had fit me just days ago now looked like something from the children's department in my hands. With nothing else to do for it, I went to Coach Simmons's office and knocked on the door.

She opened the door quickly. "Yes, what can I do... for... you... ?" she asked, as she got her first good look at me.

I held up my old uniform. "I have a small problem."

"I can see that. Well, I may have a small problem of my own: I don't know if we have anything your size." She went back into her office, and returned with some sweats. "The absolute largest things I have. If these don't fit, you'll have to sit out P.E."

I went back into the locker room and put them on. They rode higher on my forearms and shins than I was used to, but they were better than nothing.

For P.E., Coach had us play basketball. My teammates looked me up and down, then said, "You're the guard."

In many ways, it was the ideal position for me. I didn't have to handle the ball, I just had to prevent opposing players from getting a clear shot at our basket. Nothing's easier for someone who stands taller than the rest of the class can jump.
15331111111.title: phys ed.

153311111111.content:
When Coach told us to hit the showers, a lot of my classmates congratulated me. Showering after P.E. was difficult, as I had to hunch over to get completely clean. Not enough high school students are 7 feet tall to justify putting the shower heads up that far, I guess.

As I was getting dressed, one girl surprised me by hugging me. "Where did this come from?" I asked.

"My grandparents told me," she explained, "they knew a giant girl who felt unloved, and she killed herself. I don't want you to feel that way, Nancy. You are loved."

The other girls agreed, and they hugged me, too.

Word about this didn't take long to spread, as I was getting hugs all the way to my next class, History.

Mr. Bellowes had apparently heard about me, and rearranged both the desks and the seating chart. I was now sitting in the back of the classroom, in a taller chair, behind a taller desk.
153311111111.title: Next Class

1533111111111.content:
The next growth spurt happened as I was about to get onto the bus. Only this one hurt a little more than the last few and I buckled over. I must have passed out for a moment because the next thing I knew, I was surrounded by my classmates, a teacher, the nurse and the bus driver. "You gave us all a bit of a scare, young lady." Gently, Mr. Moore said. "How do you feel?"

"Fine, I guess... a little dizzy." Sitting up, I replied. "What happened?"

"You grew three feet." Wincing, the nurse said.

"What?!" I looked down and gulped. Sure enough, I was now close to ten feet tall, too tall for the bus. I began to tear up and cry. "How am I going to get home?"

"This was where your grandmother stopped growing for a while but I do not know if it will be the same for you." Serious, Mr. Moore said. "Don't fret... I have contacted an old friend to try to help you, she should be here soon."

"Who?" Curious, I asked.

"Up here..." Giggling, a feminine voice said.

Startled, I looked up and found a woman who looked to be at least forty feet tall! All of my classmates were staring too to which the giant woman merely smiled and gave a kind wave with her fingers. "Don't worry, after ten years, I'm used to it."

"Who are you?" Curious, I asked.

"My name is Isa Colossus." Kindly, the giant replied. "Mr. Moore was also my teacher only at an online class. I lived on the other side of the country." She smiled. "I just recently confessed to Mr. Moore that I was a giantess."

"So you are here to help me..." Hopeful, I asked.

Isa nodded. "I come from a long line of giants." Smiling, she said. She sighed. "If my family had known about your grandmother, we would have helped her."

"The point is, Isa is here to help you through these difficult times." Calmly, Mr Moore said. "She has also brought a number of legal papers."

"Legal papers?" Confused, I asked. "For what?"

"To keep the wolves at bay." Serious, Isa replied. "There are people who would profit greatly off of a giantess, you need to be prepared before they take notice of you."

I nodded. "I appreciate but I'm curious... how did you get here?"

Isa giggled then pointed to a semi truck. "Come take a look."

She helped me to my feet and led me to the truck with everyone following. The truck looked normal until Isa opened a large door in the trailer. Inside was a huge seat with pedals, steering wheel, a gear shift and a digital screen. "This allows me to travel without anyone batting an eye." Grinning, she said. She laughed. "You should have seen the look on the guy's face who tried to 'brake check' me on the freeway."

"Can I get a ride?" Hopeful, one of the students asked.

The other students voiced their hopes of getting a ride only Isa shook her head. "Sorry, but I can't do that." To everyone's disappointment, she said. "Not without parental written approval, anyway." She turned to me. "I'll take you home."

As I jumped into pass anger seat behind Isa in the trailer, I said, "You know they are going to ask their parents for permission."

Isa nodded. "I know. Again, I'm used to it."
1533111111111.title: I get giant help.

15331111111111.content:
The screen in the trailer showed everything around the semi as we drove, so I had no trouble directing Isa to my house. When Mom came out to see what was up, I honestly don't know what surprised her more: seeing how much I had grown, or seeing Isa.

"Your little girl is alright, Mrs. Duquesne," Isa assured her. "I just gave her a lift, since she's now too big for the bus."

"Too big for the house, too, I'm afraid," Mom said. "Time to show you the barn."

Mom led us out to the massive barn behind the house. "Open her up."

I did. I had to duck to get inside, but Isa had to crawl. "Holy cow!"

It looked like a barn from the outside, but the inside looked like a small apartment, greatly magnified. The kitchen and the living room shared the main area, with the bedroom and bathroom at the back. "Not bad," Isa said. "If you want, I can call in some friends to update the space. What worked for Nancy Archer might not work as well for Nancy Duquesne."

"Thank you, Isa. And, Nancy, you should know that the school called. They say you're too big for the building, so your school days are over."

"I knew that was coming. Thanks, Mom."
15331111111111.title: Arriving at home.

153311111111111.content:
"Don't worry, Nancy... you can take classes online just as I did." Kindly, Isa said. "Also, I invited a friend I met on my honeymoon over to help me get you settled."

"Really... who?" Curious, I asked.

My question was answered by the roar of an engine. I turned to find a huge camper truck only shortly after it came to a stop, the side of the camper opened upward. Inside was a similar set up to Isa' semi where a fifty foot woman stepped out and approached Isa with a smile on her face. "Thank you for coming, Summer." Kindly, Isa said. "Nancy is off to a good start but her apartment..."

Summer looked into the barn and giggled. "Yup, it needs a bit of an upgrade." She turned to me. "My name is Summer Roberts. We all heard stories of your grandmother and we all agreed that you need a better start."

"How did you start?" Curious, I asked.

"Everyone has their own personal trigger which starts the growing process." Honestly, Isa explained. "Mine was meeting a giant gentleman."

"Exposure to a new fertilizer for me." Smiling, Summer said. "I got literally showered in the stuff and it stunk to the high heavens."

I winced. "Ew..." I then shook my head. "What do you think my trigger was?"

"It could have been anything, really." Calmly, Isa said. "Only let's focus on your new apartment accommodations."

I watched, curious as Summer and Isa took measurements of the apartment then got onto their cellphones, making calls. Once done, they began removing everything which startled mom. "What are you doing?!" Worried, she demanded.

"We're putting in all new furniture and appliances." Calmly, Summer replied. "You have nothing to fear, Mrs. Duquesne." She pronounced is 'Doo-Kane'.

Mom smiled slightly. "You are the first to pronounce my surname right..."

"We giants have good ears." Winking, Isa said.

I jumped hearing more engines and saw other custom truck arriving with three more giants approach with large boxes in hand. "Nancy, this is my husband, Jason, my sister, Sam and her life mate, Andrea."

The giants nodded, smiling as they were introduced and got to work. "Here I thought my grandmother and I were the only ones." tearing up, I said.

"Oh, Nancy, you were never alone." Kneeling down, Summer said. "This is a great community and you now know there are other giants out there." She smiled. "We'll exchange numbers before we leave."

I nodded, tears flowing. "I'd like that."

My new apartment was ready within a few hours and I stepped in to find all the comforts of home only in my size including a jumbo tron television, a stove the size of a mid-sized car and a bed fit for a queen. "Of course, all of this will have to be adjusted as you grow more." Kindly, Sam said. "But we are just a phone call away."

"When you eventually head out into the world, looking for a job, I can hook you up with a few good employers." Smiling, Summer said.

"Thank you, thank you all!" Crying, I said. "You- you are too kind..."

It was a touching scene as I was embraced by new friends, the giants from California.
153311111111111.title: Settling In

1533111111111111.content:
My first day of online classes was something else. I couldn't do online P.E., so I found some exercise videos, and followed what they did. The best part was, when it was time to hit the shower, I could stand up straight while I washed.

The school had set up my virtual classes according to my pre-growth schedule, so I took the same classes. The difference was, instead of walking from one class to the next, I sat at the computer. The teachers would turn on a monitor at the start of my class, and "dismiss" me by switching it off again. I spent the downtime between classes either by texting my friends or fixing my lunch.

After school let out, I wowed my friends by showing off my new home. They warned me that they had every intention of making my house the ultimate hangout spot.

******************************


A week went by, and I was still 10 feet tall. I was clearly taking after Grandma. The difference was, she thought she was all alone against those who would exploit her, while I had friends and legal protection.

However, that still left me waiting for an unknown trigger that would make me shoot up another 40 feet. And I still didn't know what happened to make me grow as much as I had.

For Isa, it was love. For Sam, it was a baby on the way. For Summer, it was getting doused in experimental fertilizer.

"Megavitamins."

I remembered how, a week ago, I had been looking for some way to improve my athletic performance. I read online about someone saying megavitamin therapy could give you a boost, so I talked Mom and Dad into letting me give it a try.

Well, the megavitamin therapy didn't help. The vitamins were crazy expensive, tasted terrible, and they went right through me. If you want to pee a rainbow, and spend a lot of money to do it, give megavitamin therapy a try. Otherwise, it won't do a thing.

Or will it? Maybe the huge doses of vitamins were what caused me to start growing.

I grabbed the phone and called Mom.
1533111111111111.title: Online schooling begins.

15331111111111111.content:
Mom picked up on the third ring. "How's it going, Nancy?"

"Mom, do you still have the bottles from my megavitamin therapy?"

"At those prices? Of course we didn't throw them out."

"Do a search on the manufacturer, please."

"I suppose I could. Why, is this for - Wait, that was just last week, wasn't it?"

"Just a few days before I found out I was destined for big things."

I heard the keys click on her keyboard. "Didn't one of your new friends say she was doused in fertilizer?"

"Yeah."

"The parent company of the manufacturer of your vitamins owns other businesses. Take a guess what one of their other companies makes."

"Experimental fertilizer?"

"Nailed it on the first try. This would be one wild coincidence. I'm going to take a deep dive. I'll call you when I find something." With that, she hung up.

******************************


It was after dark when Mom called again. "Your vitamins were made from vegetables grown using that experimental fertilizer. The average person, taking the prescribed dose, probably wouldn't have anything unusual happen to them. But take someone with a family history of gigantism, and have that person take megadoses,... "

"And you've got a giant teenager on your hands," I finished. "That was my initial trigger, just like the meteorite was Grandma's initial trigger."

"I'm inclined to agree. So, mystery solved?"

"Half of one, at any rate. We still don't know what triggered the second round of Grandma's growth, so we're completely clueless about Round 2 for me."

Something told me, though, that I wouldn't have to wait long to find out.
15331111111111111.title: Mystery Solved

153311111111111111.content:
Gina and Joyce came over to my barn apartment on Saturday afternoon. "No matter how many times I come here," Gina said, "I cannot get over this place."

"I just love it here," I said. "And, if any further growth is triggered, I can get bigger furniture and appliances."

"Hey, Nancy," Joyce asked, "what's in those big boxes up there?"

I looked where she pointed. "I'm not sure," I replied. "I've been meaning to check them out, but I haven't gotten around to it yet."

"Why not now?" Gina asked. "Maybe we can help."

That was good enough for me. I climbed up and began bringing the boxes down.

Once the boxes were on the ground, we began checking them out. "For a giant's place, the boxes are small enough for us," Joyce observed.

"This stuff belonged to a Nancy Archer," said Gina.

Nancy Archer? "Grandma!" We went through the boxes with greater curiosity.

We found several boxes of clothes, some of those clothes big enough for a 50 foot woman. "If the Linen line ever gets too small for you," Joyce said, "you've got a replacement wardrobe."

"Hey," I said, "take a look at this." It was a beautiful necklace, with a gemstone that almost seemed to glow.

"That's beautiful, Nancy," Gina said. "It would look spectacular with just about anything you own."

"Hey," Joyce said, "there's a note." She unfolded it. "It's from your grandmother."

"Read it."

She began to read:

To whoever finds this:

You do not want this necklace. My Harry made it for me. He wanted it to be a reminder to me that the same meteorite that had changed my body so much could also bring beauty. However, I believe that was the last thing he should have done. I began to grow again, even larger than before. If I knew how to destroy it, I would have done so. Instead, let my words be a warning to you.

Nancy Archer, the 50 Foot Woman

When Joyce finished reading, I screamed in agony. I had felt this before, so I had an idea of what was coming.

Sure enough, I grew again, reducing my dress to a pile of linen rags.

When I stood up again, I saw that I was now 15 feet tall.
153311111111111111.title: An Important Find

choices: A New Shower, and My Next Growth Spurt
1533111111111111111.content:
"Holy crap!" Joyce said. "Nancy! Are you okay?"

"Getting there," I replied. "I almost forgot how much it hurts to grow so much."

"I guess it was a good thing we found those boxes of clothes," Gina said.

"Yeah. I'm going to need all of them."

******************************


After Gina and Joyce went home, I placed a call to Summer. "Hi, Nancy," she said, "good to hear from you. How's everything?"

"The good news is, I found out what triggered my grandmother's ultimate growth," I replied. "The bad news is, it was a gift from Grandpa. The worse news is, it's done the same thing to me."

"Oh, dear. Did you at least get the package I sent?"

"I'm afraid not. Is it supposed to be a surprise?"

"No, but I had hoped it would help you. It's a special ointment my grandmother created. Rub it all over your body after you shower, and it'll take away the growing pains."

"Sounds like I could have used it today."

"Well, hopefully, it will help you for the rest of your growth spurts. I really want to help you, Nancy. You remind me of me when I was growing. Like you, I was scared, thinking I was the only one in the world this had ever happened to. You aren't alone, Nancy. You are part of a community, and we all help each other, just like I know that you'll help the next giant you meet."

"I intend to, Summer. In the meantime, I'm in need of a bigger shower, and I've got a meteorite fragment that needs to be disposed of."

"I'll call on some of my relatives to help you out. I'd do it myself, but I've got my babies to think of."

"I understand, Summer. You'll do what you can."

After I hung up, Mom came to the barn. "Sorry to bother you when you're dealing with this, but a huge box just came for you."

It was the ointment. Well, better late than never.
1533111111111111111.title: Reactions

15331111111111111111.content:
About an hour after my conversation with Summer, I got a call. "Hello," said the woman on the other end. "Am I speaking to Nancy Duquesne?"

"You have me at a disadvantage, Miss," I replied.

"My name is April, and I represent Ron & Don Construction. We received a call referring us to you."

I got it now. "Ron & Don must be the relatives Summer mentioned."

"She's their niece." April asked me questions about my size and rate of growth, then promised I would hear from Ron and Don the next day.

She wasn't kidding. Ron and Don showed up the next morning. They installed appliances and brought in furniture that they said would serve me until I was 35 feet tall. I was eternally grateful.

When they left, the first thing I did was take a shower, so I could use the ointment.

******************************


Gina and Joyce came over the next day to see my new setup. "What do you think?"

"It's terrific," Joyce said. "Giants do wonderful work."

"It's not as spacious as it was," said Gina, "but I guess that's unavoidable."

We were sitting around, watching TV, when my clothes started to feel tight. A moment later, I heard fabric ripping, and I realized I was growing again.

"Whoa," Joyce said. "Are you okay? You didn't scream."

"I've got this ointment," I explained. "Growing doesn't hurt anymore."

"Wow," Gina said. "You are not the same Nancy who was terrified at the prospect of growing."

"That was when I thought my grandmother and I were the only ones like this. Now, I'm part of a community."

"So you're not scared of being 50 feet tall?"

"One of my best friends is 50 feet tall."

I measured myself: I was now 20 feet tall. And, as I told Joyce and Gina, I was looking forward to the next 30 feet.
15331111111111111111.title: A New Shower, and My Next Growth Spurt

153311111111111111112.content:
Mom came in. "You have mail, Nancy. Do you want me to open it?"

"Sure, Mom."

She opened the envelope and pulled out three sheets of paper. She read the first sheet:

Dear Nancy,

I told a couple of my little friends about you, and they asked me if they could write to you. I said yes. I think you'll like what they have to say.

All the best,

Summer


Mom went to the next letter:

Dear Nancy,

I first met Summer when she was seven and a half feet tall. She was the biggest lady I'd ever seen, and I didn't believe her when she said she was still growing. But she was, and I got to see how much she kept growing. Mommy says she was scared when she first saw Summer, but now she knows she's a hero. I hope I get just as big and strong as her when I grow up. I eat my veggies every day to make it happen.

Ashley


Then came the last one:

Dear Nancy,

My friend Summer says you're growing. That's so cool! I love giants, and I hope I get to be one. You must be so lucky.

Joey
I

"She wasn't kidding when she called them 'little friends,'" Mom said. "By those letters, I doubt they're much older than five or six."

"And both of them want to be giants when they grow up," Gina said. "How about that?"

"If you were still worried that people would be scared of you," Joyce added, "now you know that not everyone will be."

"That I do, I replied. "That I do."
153311111111111111112.title: Reader's choice

1533111111111111111121.content:
That night, I found it difficult to sleep. I do not know what it was but something was telling me to be awake. Fortunately, it was a Saturday so I had no school to worry about so I decided to make myself an early breakfast. "I'll have to call Summer later on and ask if this is a giant thing." Yawning, I muttered.

I started a large pot of coffee and began cooking a full box of pancakes before throwing in a big pot of oatmeal. I still could not believe I had such a huge appetite but then again, I was still growing. I had just brought my breakfast to the table when I heard the barn door creak then creak again. Someone was trying to sneak inside. At first, I thought it was some random burglar and decided to give him or her a surprise. I waited in the shadows near the door and waited. Only the surprise was mine when I spotted a nine foot boy slowly enter and look around.

"There are more giants than me...?" Tearfully, he muttered.

"Yes there are." Startling him, I replied.

The boy jumped and tried to run out only he tripped over his own shoes and ended up falling completely inside my apartment. He was rather cute with his fair brown hair and blue eyes... his blush made him even cuter. "I- I'm sorry to trespass." Stammering, he said. "I- I was just- just looking for a place to sleep for the night."

I unsuccessfully hid a bemused grin. "You could have knocked." I offered the boy my hand. "I couldn't sleep so I made some breakfast... are you hungry?"

The boy blushed even more before shyly smiling. "I am a little hungry."

I giggled. "Then let's have a little chat over some breakfast." Helping him up, I said. "My name is Nancy Duquesne."

"I- I'm Skylar Flynn." Shyly, the boy replied. "I sort of ran away... afraid I was going to hurt someone being so big."

"I thought the same when I first started growing." Honestly, I said. "My grandmother was Nancy Archer."

"The Nancy Archer, the fifty foot woman?" Surprised, Skylar asked.

I nodded. "She too thought she was alone and committed suicide." Sadly, I said.

"I came from a desert town north of here." Changing the subject, Skylar said. "It only has a population of around a hundred so everyone knows everyone."

"And trouble can brew quickly for those who fall out of the norm." Sighing, I said. "Well, you need not worry, you are not alone. There is a whole community of giants out there and they look out for each other."

Skylar blushed again, trying to hid it with his cup of coffee. "I had always hoped there were more giants out there, I just did not expect to meet one as beautiful as you."

Now it was my turn to blush. "You- you're just saying that..."

"No, I mean it." blushing as well, Skylar said. "You are beautiful..."

"Not to shabby yourself, Skylar..." Smiling, I said.
1533111111111111111121.title: "Who's There?"

15331111111111111111212.content:
We were talking over breakfast when Mom came in. "Nancy, I'm going shopping," she said. "Do you need any... What the hell?"

"Good morning, Mom. This is Skylar Flynn. He just needs a place to rest his head."

"And don't you think I might have something to say about my 14-year-old daughter having a boy over? When were you planning on telling me?"

"He came in while I was fixing breakfast. I would have called you right after we ate. I got kind of an early start. I wonder if giants have a sort of sixth sense when one of us is in distress? Anyway, I made breakfast, and he came in looking for a place to crash. Am I babbling?"

"Yes," Mom and Skylar said together.

I blushed. This was the longest I'd been in the company of a boy since puberty.

"I don't want to make trouble, Mrs. Duquesne," Skylar said. "I've been on the run since I started growing. I'll look for another place after I do the dishes."

I don't know if it was the similarity of his plight to what could have been mine, or the use of the family name, or his volunteering to do the dishes, but something brought Mom around to Skylar's side. "You may stay for a while, Skylar," she said. "While I'm out, I'll look for another place where you can stay for longer."

"And I'll email a friend of mine," I said. "There's an ointment that knocks out growing pains. I don't know how big you're going to get, but let's assume you're not done growing."
15331111111111111111212.title: Mom walks in.

153311111111111111112122.content:
Shortly after mom left, I heard a faint ringtone. It was coming from Skylar who blushed hearing it ring. "I think someone is trying to call you." Calmly, I said.

Skylar gulped then retrieved his phone and answered. "Um... hello..."

"Skylar!" scolding, a female voice cried. "It's your mother! Where are you?! The whole town is worried sick about you!"

Surprise showed on Skylar's face. "The whole town...?" Tearing up, he asked.

"The whole town!" Tearfully, his mother confirmed. "Please, where are you!?"

"May I...?" Whispering, I asked.

Not knowing what to do, Skylar handed me the iPhone. "My name is Nancy Duquesne, a twenty foot giantess." Kindly, I said. "Your son had run off to try to find other giants and found me just outside of Los Vegas while I was making breakfast."

I heard Mrs Flynn call away from the phone, "I found him, he is with a giantess just outside of Las Vegas!"

I then heard cheers rise in the background before Mrs. Flynn turned back to the phone. "Las Vegas is only a few hours drive from here." Crying, she said. "Can you please hold him there so we can come talk to him?"

"I assure you Mrs Flynn, your son is very safe here." Calmly, I said. "I then gave her my address and added, "Skylar was afraid he was going to hurt someone."

"He got the worry gene from me." Giggling slightly, Mrs Flynn said. "Please tell him that I love him and that I am coming to him as fast as I can."

"We are coming." Jumping in a male voice said. "We want Skylar to know that the whole town is behind him."

I turned to Skylar now freely crying and turned to the phone. "He knows." Calmly, I said. "I'll give the phone back to him so you can talk."

After giving the phone back to Skylar, I called mom. Hours later...
153311111111111111112122.title: A worried community.

1533111111111111111121222.content:
Mom had returned home shortly after I had called her. She, Skylar and I had a long talk about how our community had pulled together after my grandmother's tragic death. "Movie makers love to turn a tragic story into a horror film because it makes money." Sadly, mom said. "We lost one fight with the movie company in court but we won the war which forced the company to change the character names and locations so we would be left in peace." she sighed. "It was what she would have wanted."

"They made a killing off of the movie but they will not be making a sequel off of me." Serious, I added. "Thanks to a community of giants in California, I have legal protection from those wolves."

"That would come in handy." Softly, Skylar said.

"We also got a great ointment from our giant friends that will help you with the growing pains when your next growth spurt comes." Kindly, mom said. "I'll write down the recipe for you before you leave for home."

"I'd appreciate that." Smiling, Skylar said. "You are both very kind."

Mom was about to respond but stopped as we heard noises coming from outside. "What is that..." Walking to the door, mom asked. "It sounds like..."

She opened the door to reveal a small marching band approaching the barn playing 'For he is a jolly good fellow'. Behind them was a large group of people cheering and crying out kind words for Skylar. Some were carrying signs that read 'We love you Skylar' and 'Please come home'.

"It looks like your whole town came to show their support." Smiling, I said.

Skylar was smiling, tears of joy streaming down his face. "They all came here just for me... what..."

"Not all small towns fall apart in a crisis like horror movie makers like to depict." Smiling, mom said. "Many band together and become stronger for the experience."

A petite woman and a tall man came running from the crowd and embraced Skylar as best the could with him returning their embrace, crying. "Mr. and Mrs. Flynn, I presume." smiling, I said. "I am Nancy Duquesne."

The couple looked up at me in surprise then embraced me and mom. "I am Gwen and this is my husband, Archer." Introducing themselves, Gwen said. "Thank you so much for looking after our little boy."

"We knew you were looking for love, son." Lightly teasing, Archer said. "But you could have left a note..."

Skylar and I both blushed at that just before he grew three feet before our eyes, reaching twelve feet in height. He grunted under the strain of his body growing but managed to ride it out. "Well at least we have a better idea what the trigger for your growth spurts is." Smiling, mom said. "Infatuation."

The crowd of townsfolk cheered and laughed as Skylar and I blushed further. "We're just friends." Lamely, I said.

"Yeah... just friends." With a shy smile, Skylar confirmed.

"Sure you are..." Grinning, Gwen said. After a thought, she added. "For helping our son, why don't you all come with us... we'd love to show you some old fashioned small town hospitality."

Mom and I looked at each other then slowly smiled. "We would be honored."
1533111111111111111121222.title: An entire community arrives.

15331111111111111111212221.content:
Gwen Flynn outdid herself when it came to hospitality, I'd say. I know from experience that it's not easy satisfying my appetite, but she certainly put some effort into it. And don't think I didn't notice that she sat me next to Skylar. Not that I'm complaining, mind you.

As we ate, Archer asked about us. Apparently, he was named for someone on my maternal grandfather's side of the family, so he wanted to hear stories from Mom.

He asked about me, too. "Why'd you bring extra clothes along, Nancy? Your mom didn't."

"Mom isn't a growing girl, Mr. Flynn. I am."

"Still? How, uh, how big do you think you'll get?"

"Fifty feet, like my grandma."

"They were telling me about it when you all came for me" Skylar said. "Hollywood made a hatchet job of a movie about her grandmother, but she's been protected from anything like that happening again."

"Excuse me, Mrs. Flynn," I said.

"Yes, dear?"

"Could you direct me to the not so little girl's room?"

"Of course, dear. I think we can help you. Right this way."

After ascertaining what I needed to do, she invited me to let nature take its course in the pasture. As I did so, I got another growth spurt.

"Oh, my," she said. "How is it that you aren't in nearly as much pain as Skylar goes through?"

"The secret is a special ointment, Mrs. Flynn. Mom gave Skylar the recipe. Just rub it on after a shower, and you won't feel a thing. Could you please get my change of clothes?"

I'll say this for Mr. Flynn: If he was surprised to see that his 20-foot-tall dinner guest had become 25 feet tall, he hid it well.
15331111111111111111212221.title: Small town hospitality.

153311111111111111112122211.content:
Skylar blushed brightly upon seeing me return from the pasture. It was not because of my new height but my rosary pattern summer dress, it accented my figure very well. "Wow... you look breathtaking." Whispering, he said.

His body responded to his reaction by growing another three feet, ripping his clothes at the seems. I blushed seeing him then giggled with him soon following. It was then obvious to everyone we had feelings for each other. As Skylar excused himself to change clothes, I took my seat next to mom who I noticed was smiling.

"You have plenty of time to get to know him before going out on a date, you're only fourteen." Lightly scolding, she said. "Don't think for a second I didn't catch that look in yours and his eyes."

"The same goes for you, young man." Smiling, Mrs Finn said as Skylar returned. "Get to know each other better before running off on some romantic get away."

Skylar and I grinned at each other, causing dad and Mr Finn to chuckle. "Ah, to be young and in love..." Smiling, dad said.

I looked around at the smiling faces of the community but paused as I saw a petite young girl wince slightly as she caught my eye. Sitting next to her was a tall and muscular boy who offered a flat smile. I kindly smiled back and shrugged it off before turning to Mrs Finn. "The food is excellent." Complimenting her, i said. "Would you mind sharing a few recopies?"

Mrs Finn giggled. "thank you for the compliment but I can't take the credit." Smiling, she said. "Skylar cooked it all, he really good at it."

"It was a fun challenge having to cook everything on the outside grill." Blushing, Skylar said. "I'm really glad you like it..."

He and I began to hold hands to which mom opened her mouth to say something but dad stopped her with a shake of the head. "You're not going to stop them, honey." Calmly, he said. "Just let nature take its course."

"I just don't want my little girl to get hurt..." Wincing, mom said.

Dad chuckled. "There is an entire community of giants out there who have become sweet on her." Smiling, he said. "That... and have you ever seen her happier?"

Mom giggled. "Never..."

All the while, Skylar and I looked into each other's eyes, just dying to kiss...
153311111111111111112122211.title: More with Me and Skylar

1533111111111111111121222112.content:
I was giggling like a little school girl by the time we returned home. When this had all started, I thought I was alone in the world much like my grandmother was. Only now, I not only found an entire community of giants but a sweet boy as well who I very much think I'm falling for. "I've got to call Summer!" Giggling, I said.

"She could be asleep at this hour." Smiling, mom warned. "You might want to wait until morning before you call her." She smiled. "I talked to Skylar's parents, we will all be taking a weekend vacation to California to meet the other giants. Mrs Colossus has already made arrangements with a modified air hangar she was planning to use as a summer home we can all use during our stay."

This news made me even more excited but I reluctantly agreed to wait until morning before calling Summer. I knelled down so mom could kiss me on the forehead then waved as she went back to the house. Upon closing the door to my barn apartment, I ran for the phone. I was just too excited to wait. "It's not like a promised to wait." I dialed her number and waited anxiously. She answered on the third ring...

"Summer Roberts speaking."

"I didn't wake you, did I?" Softly, I asked.

"No, no." Calmly, Summer replied. "I just got back from a college football game. What's up?"

"I... met someone." Softly, I said. I could not help giggle in excitement. "I think he might be the one..."

"Oh...?" Summer asked. I could almost see her grinning. "Who is this young suitor, and how did you get to know him?"

"His name is Skylar Flynn, from a desert town a few miles away." Joyously, I replied. "He had run away from home, fearing he would hurt someone, being nine feet tall, and stumbled upon my barn apartment."

"He sneaked in?" Surprise in her voice, summer asked.

"He did, but I was already awake... something was telling me I would have to be for some reason." Calmly, I said. After a pause, I asked, "Is there some sixth sense among giants along those lines?"

"Well, when I heard the phone ring, something was telling me it was important." Honestly, Summer said. "So perhaps, yes, we do... But, please tell me... what is this Skylar like?"

"Oh, he's wonderful..." Dreamily, I said. "It turns out his entire town was worried about him, and, when they learned where he was, the whole town came to convince him to come back home."

"That sounds wonderful." Kindly, summer said. "What does he look like?"

"He has fair brown hair and blue eyes." Sighing, I said. "He's really cute when he blushes..." I smiled, remembering our first encounter. "When his dad teased him about looking for giant love, he grew three feet on the spot." I could not help giggle. "Your grandmother's ointment is becoming famous."

Summer laughed. "What does your mother think of all this?" Bemused, she asked.

"She wants me to wait before dating him." With a huff, I replied. I imitated mom's voice, "You have plenty of time to get to know him before going out on a date, you're only fourteen..."

"She sounds like my mother." Giggling, Summer said. "Will we be meeting him soon?"

"Mom and I are coming out to California as part of our winter vacation." Now excited, I said. "You visited us, so it's only right we do the same."

"Where will you be staying?" Curious, Summer asked.

"Mrs Colossus has already made arrangements for us to stay at a converted air hangar she was planning to use as a winter home." Happily, I said. "We will be arriving early next weekend."

"I look forward to it." Smiling, Summer said.

After a few more minutes of talk, we ended the call and I fell back into my bed, giggling like a little girl...
1533111111111111111121222112.title: Calling Summer roberts.

15331111111111111111212221121.content:
When Joyce and Gina came over after school, they asked, "What's new with you, Nancy?"

"I met a boy," I replied. "His name's Skylar Flynn."

"Where did you meet him?" Joyce asked.

"Where can someone your size meet someone?" Gina added.

"He came here. He got scared when he started growing, and he ran from his village to my barn. He came looking for a place to rest, and he was surprised when he saw me living here."

"That had to be scary," Joyce said.

"Not really. I had woken up early. It's like I have a sixth sense for my fellow giants." Speaking of which, something seemed to be telling me that something was going to happen. Too bad it wasn't telling me what would happen.

"So," Gina said, "other than him being a giant in the making, what can you tell us about Skylar?"

"Oh, he is so cute," I replied. "Brown hair, blue eyes, and you should see him blush."

"I think someone's got a crush," Gina said to Joyce.

"I think he's the one," I replied.

"But does he feel that way about you?"

"I'm sure he does. Every time he looks at me, he grows another three feet."

"Sounds pretty decisive," Gina said. "Well, we've got to be going. Come on, Joyce."

Joyce got up, but fell down just as quickly, screaming in pain.

"Joyce!" Gina dropped to her knees at Joyce's side. "What's wrong? Speak to me!"

Joyce said nothing, but her clothes ripped at the seams.

"She's growing," I said.

Soon enough, Joyce stopped growing, and looked around. "What happened?"

"You've had a growth spurt," I explained.

Joyce stood up, and saw the truth of what I'd said. When they'd walked in, Joyce had been an inch shorter than Gina. Now, she stood two inches taller.
15331111111111111111212221121.title: Telling my frends about Skylar.

153311111111111111112122211211.content:
"Oh my God! I'm growing! I'm growing!" Joyce screamed, in what sounded like a mixture of terror and excitement.

"You're going to be okay, Joyce," Gina said, reaching up to stroke Joyce's hair. "Nancy, tell her she's going to be okay."

"You're going to be just fine, Joyce," I assured her. "You're joining a community that's larger than you know."

"How... how big will I get?"

"There's a wide array of sizes. The shortest I've heard of is seven feet tall. The tallest is 100 feet tall. And you may as well know: the taller you get, the less you will feel like wearing. I don't wear underthings anymore, and I think I'd like to show my belly."

Joyce sat down, and Gina glared up at me. "I thought we were trying to help her."

I shrugged. "What was I supposed to do? Lie? Trust me, she will find out."

"I asked for this," Joyce whispered.

"Huh?"

"I asked for this," she said, louder this time. "I've been wishing I would grow since this started for Nancy. Every night, I've wondered what it's like to grow. I... I didn't think it would hurt this much."

"I've never heard of someone growing because they wanted to," I said, "but that doesn't mean it's never happened. I'll give you the recipe for the ointment. That will take care of the growing pains. We'll start looking for a place where you can stay, if you get too big for your house."

Joyce smiled. "Who knows? Maybe I'll be one of the shorter ones. I could live with being seven feet tall. I'd own the basketball court, and I could put the star on top of the tree."

"We'll see," I replied. "Take care, you."

The Economic Crisis hit Japan a year ago. It's like a tsunami, merciless and all, washing away everything in sight. My family's currently clinging on to a flimsy lamppost, hoping that we'll survive it. Mom, as a priestess, has been praying loads to Inari. But he doesn't seem to be helping much. Maybe he's on a holiday or something.

Well, at least we're alive for the time being.

It's the summer holidays. And with Dad working himself dizzy, and Mom praying all day and night long, I'm pretty much rather lonely. So during most of my free time, I pace about in the Shikotsu Toya National Park. It's very nearby - at the south west parts of Sapporo.

I call up my friend, Aran-Chan, and he agrees to go along this time.

"Baking sucks. I've baked maybe a hundred pieces..?" Aran tells me wearily. "So I'm taking a break."

And with that, we set off towards the Forested Mountains of the National park.

"Can't stay long," Aran sighs. "Got to get back to help my Dad out with the Bakery. Times are... hard you know?"

I nod and agree. "Same here. Mom wants me to help clean out the shrine before dinner."

But that doesn't stop us from hiking further. The nature's beautiful. But too bad hardly anyone comes here during these dark times. The newspapers even reported on poaches snooping in here and poaching wild animals. It's illegal. But they must be desperate. Everyone is desperate.

"Alex!" Aran yells in delight. "Hey! Hey! Look that way!"

I do as he says, and true enough, a fox stands by trees, looking frigid and majestic.

"Maybe its Inari!" exclaims Aran. "Maybe he has come to purge the shortage of food!"

"Inari?" I frown. "I think its just a fox."

As though to agree, the fox paws the ground.

But Aran isn't taking any chances. He bows down at once... to the fox. I try to suppress a laughter, but it bursts out anyway.

"If it is Inari," Aran scowls at me. "You're so dead."

I share a look with the fox, and to my surprise, the fox seems to be talking. Maybe its me being delusional again, but I swear! Its talking!

What is that humani doing? The fox laughs outrightly. Bowing to me?

I jump out of my skin upon hearing that. "Err.. Mr Fox...- you're.... Ah..."

Yes, I'm surprised you can hear me speak, The fox frowns. But you're unusual, and so is your friend.

"Unusual?" I ask the fox out loud. "What do you mean, Mr-"

"Alex?" Aran stands to his feet, looking at me as though I've just flown to outer space and back. "You're talking to.. a fox?"

"You were bowing to one!"

Aran grins. "I'm sorry if I'm interrupting you two," he says sarcastically. "Go on."

In the comfort of the trees, the fox chortles once more before padding off, whistling a foxy song.

I can't believe what I've just seen. But it must be a mistake! A fox? Did I just have a conversation with a fox? I rub my eyes, and when I'm done, the fox is no longer there. Well, I'm definitely delusional!

Aran and I walk some more distance, chatting on the way.

"A poacher broke in here yesterday," Aran informs me. "Those idiots!"

I shrug. I pity the animals, but it ain't the poacher's fault either. "They must really need the money."

"But..." He argues stubbornly. "It's a National Park!"

I agree him, and speak of the devil, gun shots echo in the distance. Aran and I look to each other, eyes as wide as tennis balls, before we sprint off in the direction of the gun shots.

My head suddenly starts throbbing madly. My vision begins to blur. I see Aran yelling worriedly in my direction and running epically at me in slow motion. It is amusing. But my mouth isn't mine to move anymore. Then my vision turns black, and the world seems to end.

When I gain consciousness, I find myself running at the speed of lightning. Just running, running and running. I wonder why. I try to twist my head back to see the threat, but I an invisible force forces it back front.

Stop it! a familiar voice echoes. Stop controlling my head!

What? I ask back in shock.

What're you doing in my... head? The voice demands.

WHAT?

You're the boy I met earlier, the voice says. The one I talked to.

I'm in shock. I look down at my 'feet' to find paws in place. Furry orange fur in place of skin. And I'm running- not on twos, but on fours. It occurs to me there and then, that I'm somehow, a fox!

No, you're not a fox! the voice says irritably. You're inside me! Somehow...

I'm inside a.. fox?-

Bullets appear above my/the foxes head and I realise some is shooting us. I try to turn my head behind to look, but again, the fox refuses to allow me to.

A POACHER IS AFTER ME- I MEAN US! it yells urgently. Don't look back! Run!

A poacher... Oh no, what have I gotten myself into? I'm in a fox's body or head, and a poacher is after us?

The night is young, waves lapping at the shore in the pale moonlight. To the tunes of a bygone era slowly dance timid couples, with only one or two off on their own. The singles among them sit on washed-up planks and frolic about the beach. It's a beautiful night. But up on the cliffs overlooking the bay sits the very bored and very lonely lady, Faustina Dusan. She's tired of these constant beach parties and wonders if there's anything beyond them. A longing for something, someone interesting to come along drove to her to this lookout point to seek him out. She'd just about given up the search when that someone other found her up top. Clad in red from head to toe, and uncharacteristically clean for someone coming off the beach. Tina eyed him with complete interest.

"How do you do, Miss?"

He tipped his hat to her. She took in the sight of his face for that flicker of a second before he donned it again. Young, handsome, just what she'd been picturing up here all alone. So when he offered his hand to her, she grasped it eagerly. The soft strains of the melody down below soared up to the cliff heights and carried them into a dance. With grace he waltzed her to the very edge of the rocks and back again. In his arms she floated about as if she were a breeze. The whole experience was so surreal.

And just like that, the dance ended, as did their brief acquaintance, or so it seemed.

"I must be off, for now."

"Will I ever see you again?"

"You might."

"But how will I--?"

Just as quickly as he came, he disappeared. Faustina sat back on her rocky perch and mooned over the mysterious stranger who'd swept her off her feet. Who could he be?

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------

School rolled around again with no sign of the young man. Tina sighed as she sauntered out of class. To think, in a town as small as this one, a man like that could go missing. No one else that night even registered seeing her suitor. It was bizarre and a tad unsettling. Tina tried to put it out of her mind as she opened her locker to switch out her books. Just as she went to shut it, her hand brushed across another. She spun around to see that very same gentleman who hadn't left her mind! Despite the absence of the hat, she could still tell just by his impression.

"I told you we'd meet again."

"Y-you're a student here?"

With the prying eyes of the entire student body on her, Tina stood paralyzed. The lad shut her locker.

"Perhaps we should go somewhere else?"

He motions to the front doors. Tina takes up his arm and follows him out. Whispers trail her as she goes.

"I know just the place where we can talk..."

But now, he's mostly shut himself in his study. I rarely ever see him anymore. It's left me incredibly lonely, Faustina."

"I'm sorry to hear that."

"To be honest, you're the first person I've spoken with in this town. It's so nice to meet someone like you, after moving from place to place for so many years of my life. Other times, I'd met a few 'subjects', but none so special as you've turned out to be. I've got a little something to ask you, if you'll have a seat..."

She couldn't ignore the suggestion. As she moved into place, Wylie whispered a phrase she couldn't make out in her ear. Just then, she fainted into his arms. Her breathing slowed along with her heart rate, and she could only feel a terrible chill running up and down her back. She drifted in and out of consciousness. Wylie continued to speak as she faded, muttering in that indecipherable language of his. The words rung out like a command. She felt the chill turn into burning heat, then she couldn't feel a thing and blacked out entirely.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------

Bright lights woke Tina. She jumped up from one of the lab tables that she'd earlier taken a seat upon. It seemed she was still in Wylie's house. Wylie, of course, sat across from her and had her hand in his. Some sort of watch or bracelet was on her wrist that she didn't remember wearing before, but she assumed she must have forgotten putting it on this morning. As her vision cleared up, the bracelet disappeared, so it must have been a mirage. She tried to get up, but Wylie stopped her.

"Don't worry. The temperature of the lab sometimes affects people who aren't used to it. You should be fine now. Just rest for a moment."

"I'm sorry, I just felt the need to--"

She stopped herself before finishing the sentence. Why would she want to run away from her most hospitable host?

"Just rest. Now, as I was starting to say before-- Faustina, how would you like to become my new lab assistant?"

"Lab assistant? What for?"

"Though I adore the sciences dreadfully, the truth is I can no longer work alone. The nature of my-- projects -- deem that impossible. So, in the evenings, you might visit me here and help with my work. I'll reward you with anything your heart desires."

"Anything?"

She mused on the subject ever so briefly.

"I'll do it!"
15532111.title: A Passion for Science

155321112.content:
Wylie joyously stood to shake her hand. For a moment, though, he pulled her into an embrace. His arms brushed up and down her back, stopping at the shoulder blades.

"I'm glad to hear it. Let me take you home."

He helped Tina to her feet and ushered her out the main lab door. For a moment, she thought she spied the bracelet again as he caught her arm coming into the main hall. But, a quick brush up against his side proved that the object wasn't there. Tina assumed it was the aftereffects of her brisk chill from before. As they passed out of the front door, Tina gasped at the hazy darkness over the sky.

"It's nighttime already? I didn't think we were in there so long."

"Ah, well, time flies when you're having fun..."

"Oh, what will my mother think?"

"YOU TRAITOR---!!!"

A voice rang out from the top of the mansion. Tina gazed up to see a flickering light in the tiny window up there. She wanted to stare, but Wylie turned her away.

"It's only my father, he's having one of his spells..."

He swept her into the vehicle and drove off within seconds. Though she didn't mind the haste, Tina couldn't help but pick out the shouts over the roar of the wind in her ears. She could barely make out the voice, or was it voices?

"You told me you'd changed! You dirty liar!How dare you do this to--!!!

Suddenly Wylie cranked up the radio on the car and the pounding drums drowned out the rest of the sound all the way back. Only after they reached the cliff did he return to a normal volume.

"What can I say? I like a good song now and again."

Tina looked at him incredulously, but then he slipped his arm around her. She couldn't help but smile as he swerved his way back into town. She didn't know how to describe it; she was just drawn to him. Before she knew it, they'd reached her doorstep. Instead of wondering how he knew where she lived, however, she desperately avoided getting out of the car.

"I don't know if I want to go in. My mother, you don't know her, but she's scary when she gets mad. She's a real monster!"

"Oh, hush, the only monsters in the world are the ones we make ourselves."

"Huh?"

"It's a little joke me and my father share. Don't think anything of it."

"Okay."

She walked up the path without further delay. Wylie spun her around and peered deep into her eyes.

"You'll be fine. Your mother won't even notice you."

"You're right, she won't."

"You'll come find me tomorrow after school?"

"Yes, I will."

"Good girl."

With that, he left her at the door. Tina slowly made her way inside, and sure enough, her mother didn't spot her sneaking back into her room. Tina took a huge sigh of relief and slid onto her bed. Her thoughts still stuck on Wylie, she couldn't wait to get through school tomorrow...
155321112.title: The First Midnight

choices: Working in the lab, late one night...
Gretchen takes matters into her own hands.
1553211121.content:
The last few days replayed in her head. From that night at the cliffs to the knock on her locker, the whirl of the car as it careened around corners, to the mysterious laboratory and the-- the memories always stopped after that. She remembered fainting, then the vision coming back halfway home. He, the boy, Wylie (wasn't it?), walked her to her door, and then she fell asleep. And the whole thing started over. No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't get him out of her mind. And neither could the rest of the students, it seemed.

"Have you heard about that new guy that moved to town? He started school here just yesterday! Weird, huh?"

"I'll say! I heard he lives in that creepy new house up past the cliffs."

"Someone told me it was practically built overnight!"

"Hey, Tina, didn't you see him the other day?"

"Yeah, yeah! You walked off with him just before class! What gives?"

"I even think I saw you with him on the cliffs at last week's party!"

Tina turned casually, unaware of the muddle of voices around her. She picked out two voices in particular. To her left, Elaine, and to her right, Gretchen; both were her closest companions. Both fixated on hearing her side of the story.

"Oh, gee, I don't know, girls. I only met him the other day, and he seems so nice--"

"What happened? Did he take you somewhere nice? Did he try anything funny?"

"Stop it, Elaine. All you ever think about is funny business. Obviously Tina wouldn't let a guy take advantage of her."

Tina reddened in the face, unable to truly describe what happened yesterday. Had he done anything strange to her? An inkling of suspicion crept over her mind, but it quickly faded away. She tried to focus on other things, but by the time she did, others were talking about it.

"I heard he's moved seven times in the past three years."

"Did you know he used to live on his own private island? He's filthy rich!"

"Hey, Tina, wanna hang out after school? We can go to Wagner's down the street."

Tina wanted to smile and say yes. She wanted to spend the evening in the company of her friends. But as she turned to Gretchen to reply, Wylie Methodios caught her eye again. He beckoned her forth with a wag of his finger, and she sashayed towards him entranced. She had no idea what was happening around her.

"School's out for the day. How about we head up to the lab? You do remember our agreement, don't you?"

"Yes, I do."

"Good girl."

She clung to his arm and stepped right out of the school, even leaving behind her back. Elaine gave Gretchen a telling look, but Gretchen wasn't phased. Something was horribly wrong with her best friend, and she'd find out, sooner or later.
1553211121.title: Chockful of Rumors

choices: "I'd like to stay up and observe the effects."
15532111211.content:
Tina trotted about the lab, searching out some files while Wylie set out his chemical set to work with. She snatched up a nondescript manila folder and handed it to him.

"Here are all the files on Plan 6 you wanted."

"Thanks. Now if you'll just take a seat over here..."

Tina gladly obliged. She couldn't wait to start experimenting.

"So what exactly do you want me to do for you, doctor?"

"Well, since you've so casually placed yourself on the workbench, I'd have to say you're going to play subject tonight."

"Subject? But--"

The kind little glance he threw her way quelled her fears. He was all politeness; she couldn't refuse him. Plus, who knows? What had he done to her yet that would make her apprehensive? She could help him unlock some vast discovery that would benefit all mankind! It couldn't hurt, could it?

"I suppose I could."

He took her arm in a much different manner this time, slowly slipping the needle into it. She hadn't expected that, but no resistance built up to it. Instead, Tina almost smiled at the chance to be Wylie's prized subject. As he injected the strange red chemical, she fluttered a bit. Her arm twinged a bit, and Tina watched as a flicker of scarlet swirled around her wrists. It couldn't be...

"It's nothing, you're just imagining things. Everything will be fine."

"Everything's fine."

"Good girl."

Tina snapped back as if nothing had happened. She felt invigorated, but couldn't quite place the source of her mood. Along with the burst of energy came a peculiar sensation. She felt... different. It probably was nothing. She was just imagining it.

"How are you feeling? Warm?"

"Actually, yes, which is funny. I thought it was cold in this room."

"Only yesterday. The experiment called for it, after all."

"The experiment? I thought we started today."

"Of course we did."

Wylie patted her on the back, and his hand rested there for an odd amount of time. But this time, it slid down her back to curl around her waist. Never before had a boy held her like that. Tina didn't know how to feel about it. They turned to each other.

"I feel we're making real progress, Tina. I can't wait to see what the future brings, can you?"

Tina nodded, ever so slightly.

"You'll let me know what happens, won't you?"

Tina gave acknowledgement.

"And one last thing, you won't tell anyone about this, will you?"

Tina shook her head.

"Good girl. Now, about the rest of the evening..."
15532111211.title: The Assistance Required

155321112112.content:
"How about dinner?"
